vtKjHw-tO43gn6-9OG_BuQ.text: Very good sandwiches. They all come with a side. The portion of food is very decent. Service is quick during Sunday lunch hours.

2i28_fn0yxyXVP8gHGO7pQ.text: Man this place has great food. Went here last Friday night and couldn't have enjoyed the food more. Hey, crowd was interesting and eclectic in a relaxed atmosphere. I had the Mac and cheese and it was delicious and I am often disappointed by restaurant Mac and cheese. My GF and sister for the short ribs and I was jealous as hell. I'd go back.

QypywSlOfsxilhh-7XPkvQ.text: I was at the Diamondbacks game and was starving, everything was closing at 10 pm and found this hidden gem. Food was delicious, I will be back!

JhKfhwiR7qzmw98e8i4ZTw.text: Kettle Black is a *premium* Irish-style bar for folks who want all the faux-European culture of working class pubs scattered throughout the valley, but with cleanliness and superior spirit selections of a more posh lounge.   DO try the whisky/scotch menu. It's got good stuff from America, Scotland/Ireland, and even Japan. Stuff that will knock you off your socks.   DO try the bar food, like the variations of chips. Especially Philly steak fries. They even give you two forks so you can pretend you won't try to eat it alone.   Also, watch soccer here! I enjoyed my World Cup viewing experience, and how they opened up extra early for the huge party I was in. During actual club season, it's a Manchester City bar.   Good eats, libations, and service all around, but keep in mind it's a bit compact. Seating can get cramped, and there aren't any diversions like billiards or darts here, which coupled with the lack of a patio make it feel like more of a chill spot than a place you could spend hours in partying it up. Nevertheless, totally worth an unwavering recommendation.

rp9FXn56aazanLVS55FQeA.text: Such an amazing pub! We were out promoting the Guinness Social Club around Phoenix and decided to take a lunch break. I found a seat at the bar and enjoyed my perfectly poured Guinness with some delicious Fish and Chips. The bartender Billy was outstanding and made sure we had everything we needed. Looking forward to coming back here again, the staff all around were pleasant and friendly. I highly recommend this spot! It's a must-visit for any Guinness Draught drinker!

JSnbKRYNS5uaS_q-feetfw.text: We got beer, cocktails and food. Really good! The drinks are creative and tasty. The pretzel was warm, big and had great flavor. The fish and chips are great, but the flies are a little soggy for me. My husband for the burger and it was very good. The feel is old school pub with games and excitement going on. It's loud so if you're looking for a quiet place for a date, this might not be the place for you. Overall, the food and drinks are worth the trip!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Rose and Poblano.
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flight with Cigar City, Guinness, Siera Nevada, and Victory Pilsner.

IYoDMzcD1F6psjUFGZs8Fg.text: Hubby and I came here after the Mercury and Sparks game! Awesome service. If I remember correctly our waiter's name was Christopher I think. Great service. Checked in on us frequently. I had the hot wings. They were really good and just how I like them. Battered perfectly, not too saucy. My husband order the Jamaican sliders. He enjoyed them. He said hey were nothing special but still tasty. Overall great experience here. We'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu!

bmW7JmSr8A2rT9y2j0oQgA.text: It was a great find in downtown Phoenix!!! Looked up a couple places on Yelp and I was led to The Kettle Black Kitchen. While trying new restaurants is always a little scary sometimes, this was a hidden gem in downtown Phoenix!! We were lucky to get there at 5pm, as it was already getting crowded. When we left at 6:30pm it was really crowded and the manager offered to buy all 4 of us shots if we gave up our table. Since we were already packing up and heading out, it was a no brainer!! The service was great, the food was delicious and the drinks were superb!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Santa Fe Chicken Wrap... very spicy!!!!
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Club
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7ZN6UgPU_XM58XbkVHasUA.text: Amazing food and top notch customer service. The cocktails were delicious too! Will definitely be coming back!

COq0FOT2OEUIHgkJl8gIqg.text: Great spot to day drink.   Cool bar / restaurant with good food and a great Rueben.   Cheese steak sandwich is legit.   Full bar but only 3 TVs.   I like this place a lot but if you're looking for authentic Irish pub keep looking.

k0LyFOV82kz9Kxvg6nAA9g.text: We tried this place because I saw the reviews and we were going to a Phoenix Suns game. The service was quick, but the food was just ok. I got the braised ribs and they were just ok...a little dry. My son got the cheeseburger and it was pretty small for the price. My daughter got the chicken club and said it was pretty good. Hefty price for just ok food.

kUhwupkq0z2EJB68TnjLhg.text: Stumbled upon this pub by chance and was pleasantly surprised by the whole experience.  Place is lively, clean, and has a fun vibe.  Had the southwest chicken wrap,  house salad,  and Alpine IPA... all were delicious and on par with an upscale restaurant.  Highly recommend giving this place your biz.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwest chicken wrap

NlkDoUvGxjUv4P6qeUGhAg.text: Irish pub located walking distance of Talking Stick Arena became a focal point for the night as we were looking to get a good bite to eat and previously tried this after seeing the Bruno Mars concert just weeks before.  The atmosphere is cool with televisions around, high top tables & chairs, along with a bar with just about everything you would expect from a pub.  On the menu we had the Philly cheesesteak fries and buffalo chicken fries as appetizers and for the main course we got a range of things from the salmon, the chicken club sandwich, the bacon onion marmalade burger and something else (Club sandwich I think)  Everyone enjoy their food however I was a little bit throne as the bacon onion marmalade was not what I expected. Granted, I could've just gotten bacon on the side for just a little more $ but decided to just stick with what they were doing and give it a try. The burger was cooked well however the bread that came with it was like a brioche type & seemed like it was at its last day & a bit stale.   I asked for the marmalade on the side so I was able to finish the 2nd half of the burger with some delete.  I had a bit of the salmon and it was excellent. Along with dinner I had a few Moscow Mules that helped. Been twice and everything has been good but not a fan of the burger/marmalade combo. If your. It a marmalade fan, get it on the side to try. Will come back and try some other stuff as the service was prompt & drinks were on point!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

8wy9rgRYBpH9r6UFZv1e2A.text: Michael is the absolute sweetest! Great menu knowledge and made our first time here lovely

LhnfD7gNDgtqDVoxpA1Eig.text: Stopped in for lunch Tom and his staff were awesome.  Everyone was friendly and welcoming and the food was amazing and not overly priced. Amazing place I will be back for sure.

6Sy6snHQIzrCVfuOVr-lew.text: Great service! Very attentive and quick. The ambiance was nice too! Me and my wife were on vacation passing through and this was a great addition! The beer was good and my wife said the turkey burger was amazing!

4oP6DuVIC-epQHPwBL0koQ.text: This place is awesome on the taste buds!! Had the Bavarian pretzel, amazing! Crab cakes, bomb! Fish n chips for my chica and the citrus chicken salad for me. Great place to grub! Great atmosphere! Billy thank you and see you soon!!

hbsIuGzx3gvR7dC8qm23dA.text: But pricy, decent drinks, fish & chips was the frozen kind.  Recommend it for the drinks, and maybe a snack. Not really for a meal.

_Kl5k9-3IDRrMF0kwT2Mag.text: I'm a fan! Stopped by on Friday and grabbed a couple of seats. The 1st Street burger was juicy and tasty and the fish and chips cooked perfectly. Great pub atmosphere and reasonable prices. Will be coming back,

9e45OTYcRcfNsKw42jigAQ.text: Great pub in downtown Phoenix. Food and wine were great. The pretzel appetizer was awesome. Wish I worked closer so I could come more often.

QCoAYkdeybH9eP1aQwtGKA.text: You won't be disappointed, great food, attention given to special needs like allergies. We had Alex as our waiter, he was excellent. Kudos to the chef, obviously takes pride in his/her work.

fWTyzjSAkh8mAKEruflYsg.text: 1st Street burger was deliciousness the meat was well seasoned and the bun was just a bonus! Handout fries - deliciousness my husband enjoyed his chicken sandwich! This place was inexpensive and delicious! Would definitely return! Thomas the bartender pours awesome drinks!

lJMApSrhGo5dSUDKNfpXGw.text: A little disappointed with this one. We went here prior to going to try out the escape room. The yelp reviews were pretty high and I am assuming the people who suggested it were high as well. It would appear to be an Irish pub. They have Guinness and all of the decor is a pinterest version of what a man cave should look like with an Irish theme. The menu is limited as well as the beers they have on tap. I guess they assumed having Guinness and Fish and Chips plus some Irish swag makes it an Irish pub. I ordered a Buffalo Trace Manhattan and they brought me the drink without the cherry and it didn't quite taste like a Manhattan. I asked the waitress where the cherry was and she told me the bartender does not make a Manhattan the normal way. I asked her politely if I could have it the normal way. She told me to just try it. So I just drank it. I do have to say the buffalo chicken fries were pretty good. I ordered the southwest chicken wrap for dinner. It was pretty much solid lettuce in a tortilla and was lacking flavor. The lettuce had been washed apparently fairly recently which would explain why it was watery. Honestly this place has an energy in it, but it has more to do with people in the place than the place itself. This really is a really very poor impression of Seamus McCaffrey's. If you like Irish pub's maybe try one where they do it the normal way, seriously try Seamus McCaffrey's instead.

CcRD53DpZUnqODgq7XZNjQ.text: Stumbled across this place walking through downtown. Great friendly staff. Awesome decor. Very nice selection of beers and cocktails, and to top it off DELICIOUS FOOD!

3l9gkCROa_yIwUltRSYCZA.text: This place is a block from the arena downtown Phoenix. Food is ALWAYS great and the atmosphere is cozy. Servers are friendly and helpful. I had amazing crab cakes... Really reasonable priced. Check it out!!!!!

iWYC8j4ErpasNTDQrmd3qA.text: It's amazing how fast we were served and got our meal. Between the awesome fish and chips and the pub atmosphere i could have sworn we were in Great Britain or Ireland. Can't say enough good things about this place

hgAuSy_4a0bij8dYyXnkbA.text: Great service from Kelsey, she rocks! And the food, ambiance was great also, had the chicken kabob and the salmon both great!

nEnbII-uetDzy_p1oH5fyg.text: My husband took me here as a surprise for my birthday because we had been meaning to try this place for ages! Overall, I would definitely go back and it was enjoyable. The food was above average for a pub. I did like that they had options other than the typical fish and chip fare most pubs tote. The dishes were creative and tasty but still affordable and they did have the fish and chip fare still if that's what you wanted! The ambiance was relly enjoyable and I liked the lower ceilings, darkened feel and the way the booths and tables were situated. This place honestly is great for dinner and it would be great for a happy hour or start of a night out with friends. The only suggestion I would make would be to beef up the draft beer list. The only craft beers on tap when we went were Sculpin, Racer 5, and a San Tan IPA. I could have just been unlucky, but I was definitely expecting more draft beer depth.

muds6WgpZ_yQ9hMDADrr5g.text: Downtown has been needing a bar like this for quite some time.  A smaller Irish pub with Very good service and pretty good food.  I had a burger and a bunch of us shared some appetizers (pretzel, chicken, philly fries) and it was all good.  I wouldn't mind stopping in sometime after a ball game and having a few beers.  What Irish bar doesn't have shepherds pie? Maybe it can be a special they run once a month or so - I would definitely stop in and try it.

CRPK-JCpwLHekggwq--dJQ.text: The bacon onion burger was great. Truly a phenomenal burger masterpiece. Service was mediocre, no fresh drinks and waited way to long for checks.

_pYC8aPGR8swW2d8QJ2_cg.text: Love the atmosphere! Great food and cold tasty drinks., Intimate yet warm and friendly. We were in the beginning of a Sunday pub crawl and were very tempted to just stay. Might have to make this our new Sunday spot. Highly recommend for an after hour spot or somewhere to go to just chill with friends.

ys6Cy83DRd1-KPq50nnBOQ.text: This is a great place to stop and have a couple beers and wings, basically pre-game. The beers were served at the perfect temperature and the wings were crispy with just the right amount of sauce. The celery also tasted very fresh.

rjqkvxOAit3iNKSVcRV6dw.text: Love the entire decor and atmosphere! Haven't really seen many places like that in Scottsdale so it was a nice change. I got the corned beef which was absolutely delicious. My friend and I decided a little to late to do the bread pudding once the kitchen had closed but our super adorable and kind server, Michael, made it happen for us free of charge! Incredible service and amazing food

e6IpsFCRnak_ciZoV3YxfQ.text: So disappointed. Actually walked well out of our way to check this place out. The interior is fun, but the ceasar salad was way too salty, the chicken appetizer  (kind of strips) was gross, and the curry sauce for the fries was rather bland.

9IiEwE2tYnnSc2HLkEqLXA.text: We came to town for a quick trip and this popped up on yelp. I had the bacon onion burger and my folks had the Ruben and scallops. All dishes were delicious! Large portions. The wait staff is super friendly and welcoming. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_-wnCY-cT35W8PYJbtCZ8w.text: Delicious food and great specialty cocktails! Our waiter was very attentive and friendly too. We loved the atmosphere of this bar, it definitely feels like an English pub!

PeYS7p8hWOQOTO9NyotBug.text: The food was great and the service was unbelievable. Plus in-house aged bourbon is worth paying so much more. Can't say enough for this place!!!! So good.

0MxrvB0ByXw5WS9ZUkweJg.text: My coworker highly suggested the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna Salad. After spending a week eating various types of pub food, it did me good. It was actually a slaw of cabbage, broccoli, and kale with just enough dressing. I would get this again even if my body wasn't begging for vitamins and fiber.

XBw7z8Ed00QotEgk_PdeYg.text: Nice restaurant walking distance from the sports fields.  We stopped in after a Diamondbacks game in a Sunday, and the restaurant was pretty quiet.  We sat right down and serving staff was friendly and prompt.  Wife ordered the pork belly Mac and cheese - fairly basic recipe.  I would have expected a bit more flair, which takes away a star.  I ordered the pork belly sliders - two reasonable sized slides with Asian inspired slaw - very good.    The place has a nose atmosphere, but it seems to be caught between wanting to be an American inspired bar and an Irish pub.  Still, I would recommend if in the area.

DpubN3sxqegR7kDzAJ-Jtg.text: Came here after the Dodgers beat the Diamondbacks, its within walking distance from Chase Field so that was an obvious pro. Didn't get to try any of the food, but the drinks were great. I had both the Rose and Poblano and the Dear Prudence, which were probably the best drinks I've had at an establishment.   The place itself was chill, it wasn't too packed (probably because it was a Thursday) and the ambience is relaxing. Music isn't bad either.

Rrs-PoR-1KgRoNsskg0kMQ.text: Friendly staff, delicious food, and awesome bar selection. I'm gonna have to come back after hours to enjoy the craft beer selection.   Had the blackened chicken sandwich for lunch with coleslaw. I would recommend this place for lunch or dinner and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened chicken sandwich!

1MuDWRzT4e-UqYqZCAlsrw.text: My husband and I were passing through Phoenix, where my sister lives and tried this place. I really really wanted to like it. We had to pay for parking $12. Since it seemed all the street parking at that time of day is for loading only. When we finally get there, the restaurant is almost empty with 3 other tables waiting for their food. We order two beers. They were literally overflowing as they were brought to the table. When they were sat down there was beer everywhere. They didn't even bother to clean it up. The food we ordered took 40 minutes. We asked for a coke, no ice, and it was brought with ice after we reminded the waiter twice for the drink. The food had obviously been sitting for a while as it was cold. It shouldn't have taken that long. It was a California club and fish and chips. I wouldn't return. Food was good. But it doesn't out weigh the bad service.

ZSkSP2gim3W8yaSK5uNMqQ.text: Was craving a burger and stopped in tonight with my boyfriend. Bartender was very friendly and accommodating.   Split their typical burger with garlic aioli and a fried onion ring. It was one of the best burgers I've ever had.   Shared the Philly cheesesteak fries. So. Good.   Not a huge beer selection but the ones they had were local and good.  Will def be back!

PAwD9paD5esOJG4gemhvqg.text: Stopped by when I was downtown the other day and grabbed a beer and some lunch. The Southwest Chicken Wrap was outstanding and the fries were seasoned perfectly! They have a few local beers on tap along with the typical big names!

6KmSNRowPgiTman4qcoVCA.text: Food ok. Service was terrible! Had to repeatedly ask for water. Water never came.   Place was not busy but at our table for 4 the food came out 20 minutes from first person getting their food to last person getting food.   Will not be back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our waters were empty for 30 minutes after asking for refills several times.
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Glasses the entire meal.

Yxi_PYQyTIkJrzW3kcN2uQ.text: I met my girlfriend here for lunch a couple weeks ago and I was blown away! They get sort of busy for lunch, but not nearly as busy as they should be for the food they're slinging. My friend had been there once before, ordered the steak salad, loved it, and ordered it again when we went. I dipped my pinkie in her dressing and it was divine - she was done when I did that.  I ordered the ahi tuna salad. There are few restaurant salads that impress me - particularly at a self-proclaimed "pub," but this one definitely did! It was so delicious, and, long story short, I could eat it all day, every day. I tend to order the same thing when I find something as delicious as that salad, but I hope I can convince myself to branch out the next time we go there for lunch.

2kTHNn7osPHMoO5m7I45-g.text: Service- not attentive and forgot orders  Food- mediocre plenty of other places downtown that offer more Of a selection and tastier. If you're just going for beers n chit chat it's fine .

ZoH7QheDfkbG7536t3THWg.text: The food is ok but overpriced. The place itself smells like an overload of burned grease. Their beers are pretty good which is why I gave it a three star rating instead of two.

9Yq02BKcnvY2gzgV9RCQIA.text: The service was great!   We both had the fish and chips and really enjoyed it. The fish was very crispy, well-seasoned, and appeared to be freshly battered.  We were expecting parking to be a challenge, but there was available metered parking directly in front. Lovely red doors and comfortable booths!

THvlFqVx_kNNUy53rhEaXg.text: The service is excellent. Food is awesome and fresh. The beer selection is fantastic. Try the mussels as they are different and tasty. Best fish and chips around.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gZFKrMSOLV9JYjULGq02HA.text: Nice little bar in downtown Phoenix. Reuben sandwich was loaded with pastrami and came with delish freshly sliced fries.  We walked in at 11:30 with no one there and by the time we left it was packed. Nice assortment of tap, craft, and bottled beers.  Good prices too.

BkBArgjxt2wiIwGQ4zGKZQ.text: A.Maze.ing! Great service. Kind staff. Exceptional food! The Philly cheese steak fries were even better than expected! The Citrus chicken salad was generous and full of flavor and toppings. Highly recommend and we will be back.

XbZK9gg4xEJAXxsZFkL0kw.text: We ordered 3 bacon onion burgers. They all came with no visible bacon that we could see or taste. Served said its somewhere embedded in the onions (??).. also the medium well one was cooked rare. The side order of fries came late, and were also some of the worst we've eaten (small, over cooked and oil dripping).. not a good experience at all.

5IVnNf7Ptv2tlqVRISAjcA.text: The staff is great and the food is excellent. Great place to hang out. It's always a fun time at Kettle Black

YrNze38twjhEi4wbwL6C5Q.text: Best pub in AZ hands down. Foods unreal. Staff is well trained and knowledgeable. Jay and Tom keep the party rocking all Night! Will defiantly be back. Feels like this might be my new fav hang out!!! Had the wings. Off the charts good!!

MbKdNBcHgOCrSWApBjRfpg.text: Best pretzel and cheese I've ever had! Hands down. Seriously, you gotta try it. At $6 it's a cheap eat for bar food and soooo, soooo good. I will now make it a point to stop here any time we are in Phoenix simply for the pretzel. We stopped here for a business dinner while on a trip to Phoenix. They have some decent craft drinks but the main focus at this pub is obviously the beer. I opted for a specialty cocktail in which I cannot remember the name but it was something with gin and fruit and it was delish. For dinner, I went with fish n chips that was below average. The batter was soggy and the fish was poor quality. It tasted as though they left it sitting for too long after frying it. Service that night was slow and we had to grab our servers attention a few times so don't expect anything more. But my God, that pretzel made up for it all!

dbpJAFGYEKNKypkZYSLpZA.text: Best chicken salad sandwich I've ever had. My daughter and I went to several restaurants for Mother's Day and came across this gem. The owner was definitely a foodie. Presentation and ingredients were excellent. Alex, the server, was attentive and engaging. Thanks for the experience. Next time I'm all about the bourbon selection.

eqJ6PK6ywP8B8F0ItHDISw.text: We stopped in for a quick snack and a drink to pregame for a baseball game. The bar has a cool feel and a nice atmosphere. Service was quick. Drinks were good. Menu was typical bar food and we split the buffalo chicken fries. About what you would expect from bar food. Nothing great but we would come back for sure.

9ymGH6AkFrlYv7_FkJ-fUw.text: Sometimes when traveling to a city you have never been you have to guess at where to go to eat. This chance decision had fabulous results! Our server, Wesley, was fantastic! I had questions about vegetable options and he was very helpful and informative. We had fish and chips, Brussels sprouts, and a club sandwich. Wonderful atmosphere too!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and Chips!

goAlbFRTh8LOeaED5305HQ.text: We came on a busy Saturday before a baseball game and I have to say that the owner was onsite seating people, the staff was friendly and happy to take in the crowd and provide delightful service. Having worked in the industry in another state, I don't see a lot of exceptional or urgent service in the industry in AZ. This was an exceptional experience and we are excited to come back!

bqEy0fINLRsHlUUhHmsgrw.text: First time at the Kettle Black Kitchen and Pub. More of a pub than a kitchen. Very dark, deep booths, long bar and Manchester City banners.   We arrived at noon on a Saturday and there were 12 in booths and tables plus four at the bar.   I ordered Buffalo Chicken fries and a California Club. My son-in-law got a Bacon Onion Burger and a coke. It all came to $39.64.   fries arrived in five mins  Our meals arrived eight mins later. The bread on my Club was toasted and as long as you have avocado on it, it will fall apart, which it did. Good potential for this meal but the side dish (fries) was better than the entree. Sad.   Service: a big party came in so we virtually lost our server.

Dn4b0T1VN9-M-IZSQ4K7ig.text: Those top places I like going just to enjoy a beer and some company. Their jerk chicken is great

VCjyEheHZItenB6p-vHcGw.text: Of course I had the fish and chips. As per all reviews this did not disappoint. Fish was light and fluffy. Accompanied by crispy fries. I wish there was more fish though. I have a big appetite:-) the victory Pilsner was a nice pairing. Hubby had the bangers and mash which were banging and smashing baby! Paired with a nice Guinness made his evening. The atmosphere of an old pub playing 80's alternative music enhanced the gastro experience. Nice service was icing on the cake.

OFy9QOB4oeuUOwuJB1kJQw.text: It was a nice quite Monday when I came in.  My bartender Billy is phenomenal, a gave me attention in making sure I had a full beer, and yes, cold! He immediately checked with me to ensure my Reuben was awesome, it was!   Nice little Irish bar theme, very clean, very friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AZk21OXIc9Xzj2upP57UUg.text: If you haven't had Sierra as your server you are missing out on the full experience. She has the best personality and the service and food is always amazing!

gGYvzu7D9w2-gvKv3stw4Q.text: I got the feeling of a real life pub when I walked in. Tons of beers and liquor choices. Nice decor and cozy.   The food was really good. I went in for the 1st Impression Burger but it is only served at dinner.   The menu was full of choices for you to choose from and everything everyone got, they really enjoyed.   The menu was fairly priced about $12 per person. And the portions were generous. I hope to get back in before I leave AZ to try out the burger I wanted. Lol

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black Bean Burger
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6iazU4a1jFT4ti_rRi40Mg.text: Who told me to be near Downtown Phoenix during the Final Four.... I must have lost my mind but I was there.  After an amazing DBack game we decided to try something new.    We walked into this hole in the wall pub and what a surprise..the owner was standing at the entrance and said we could be seated but the kitchen was closed... WHAT... He said they had so many customers today the kitchen was swapped...Yeah but I'm starving.    As my girlfriend and I are pouring on the charm , he said Where are you from? To my amazment we were both from NYC.... YEAH....! We got a seat and we were able to order.  I was so happpyyy!   The wait was a little while but it was worth it.  I ordered the fish and chips..... OMG... let's just say I ordered another one.  The fish was so flakey and the coleslaw was fresh.  I loved it... I mean I really enjoyed it.   This place is an treasure to the downtown Phoenix area.   It's a breath of fresh air.  Listen this is a pub with great food and even better beer.    Try this jewel!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chips with some damn good fish..in that order!
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and chips  and don&#39;t forget the chicken

IPBYHXgBq38MKqoH5b3VNg.text: I suppose you can get away with mediocre and charge for superb when you're in downtown Phoenix catering to business and conference lunch crowds. I was nearby for a conference and a few of us were lured in because of the short wait during our hour lunch break. I was underwhelmed, and I feel that the others in my party were as well. The service was good. Our server even told jokes and did a trick with the catsup bottle. So if nothing else, we were entertained. The corned beef and cabbage didn't have a lot of flavor, and the fish and chips were also pretty bland. I'd choose somewhere else.

JSlntzNWm13JsdaTGIWOuQ.text: After a long flight and getting in after 9 pm I was starving.  Found this cool pub.  The fish and chips was outstanding and my husband had the steak.  Yum!  Great service too!!

mqoYMsCBPtjpeF79aSeiAQ.text: It was ok. Ambiance was good, food was so so, bread pudding was great- really good caramel and solid but moist.

eKhdMWLbrUuKjxrFuQv6Ww.text: Stopped in on our way to a Suns game. Got great service, had great food and drinks, in a great environment. We don't explore downtown enough but said we would definitely be back here! Also a plus for us we that it was wheelchair accessible!!!!

YTkRlfJ0WA5yKSGOegF7mg.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for new restaurants to go to for our date and we came across this place. We first had the buffalo chicken fries for our starter, and let me tell you, it was delicious! My boyfriend got the California club, and I got the Bacon onion burger. His was supper good, he loved it, and of course I took a bite of his, the best club I ever had. My burger was super juicy and tasty. I wish i had another. For dessert we got the bread pudding and let me tell you that sh*t was so freaking good. Like it just melts in your mouth as our waiter Michael ( hope that's the right way to spell it ) said " caramel pancakes " and he was spot on with that. I would definitely come back here again and tell my friends and family about it. :)

fcbToebVWmh9XwTEi-CSYw.text: Went here before a D-Backs game with my buddy. Place was packed and we still managed to grab a spot at the bar. Had a delicious Bloody Mary and the steak salad. Easily best salad I have had and I'm NOT a salad guy. I have to go to this place again!!!

X33gux-kTUF1vTnReujNIQ.text: Go for the beers, not the food. Service was great, but our meh meals left us regretting our choice for dinner. Even the fries... how can you go wrong with fries? So many other places nearby will leave you better satisfied.

KwBbvZHuWfbUMHj8PwFqFQ.text: Wonderful food, nice beer selection and pleasant service! Philly Cheese Fries are worth the trip alone!

ic-6VLeiOIryODR-8dKZdg.text: We planned a night out in Downtown Phoenix and decided to give this place a whirl for dinner. Everything on the menu looked amazing, but I was trying to be good so I ordered the Steak Salad. It was quite delicious. We also ordered a Bavarian Pretzel and and Garlic Fries for the table which were also amazing! I love the decor and the atmosphere of this place and will definitely return next time I'm in downtown Phoenix!

tm6fJtX9CBmzB81McNJ00g.text: Stopped in on the Urban Ale Trail. Friendly place good drinks. Love the atmosphere

pluzgx6uvI7W3njeWRiO-A.text: Was in town from Minnesota on a Business Trip and we decided to give this place a try.  This was an excellent place, great service, incredible food.  Had the Fish & Chips and it was amazing.  Very glad we tried this place!

mJUVwLFY1Rcq5rNIF1Gq1A.text: Nice trendy atmosphere. Get the pretzel. I wasn't sold on getting a Bavarian Pretzel in Arizona. I was wrong. So darn good! The pork belly sliders are recommended, so we got em. They were not like a pork belly slider you would get in Nashville but really good.  If your there for a convention stop in here for dinner.

fYGfCptyOoTOowOBDC83WQ.text: Food was alright. Nothing really spectacular. Place was full of drunken losers when we were there. Insanely loud. Wasn't even a Friday or Saturday. Sunday, midday I believe. I can eat at better places in the valley and enjoy myself much more.

QfWueiYuPgU-jpbwmlsUHg.text: Gret food and service! I ate their steak salad 2 weeks in a raw. All other menu is great as well! Definitely a good restaurant.

I3Gf-aboaXnrclWXZM9p8A.text: We had appetizers and beer. Kinda noisy, but it was a Friday night. Good food! Will recommend!

kAI7HN-Cevp3uxKqbXTW3w.text: The best bar/pub you will find in Phoenix. Aside from the fact that the owner is amazing and good looking  the food and the drinks are absolutely made to perfection. Trust me, you want to come here when in down town Phoenix. But come early because it fills us real quick!

WrsGFCLu45s2mLo65LQM6Q.text: seriously the best pub in Phoenix....great food, atmosphere and service...our server was Alex and he was fantastic...and so was food

3XVVnHJE-xRqwSMEdelWNQ.text: I absolutely love this place. I am a local to downtown Phoenix and i have gone here many times with my boyfriend. We have always had amazing service and delicious drinks. It is affordable as well. Always clean and welcoming. I will keep coming back to this place.

TQs-gLvwNt91itHnJPDaiQ.text: If you're at a conference in the downtown Phoenix area, this is a good option-- especially during the summer as the AC is strong. Friendly service, reasonable prices, and good food. I was a bit irritated that I couldn't get the chicken wrap because they were "out of field greens" (no offer to substitute), and I was served french fries instead of coleslaw, but overall it was a good experience. I was especially impressed with the draft beer selection.

KzvcfE3f25tCZ2po94yTcA.text: Went to the kettle black kitchen twice in one day. It was very good and close to my hotel. Good atmosphere and great bartenders.

7bCayApFcSvB3DfvX1ZMgg.text: All around great spot. Corned beef and cabbage is one of my favorite dishes, and I tend to be very finicky with time honored staple.  I was beyond satisfied - they really knock it out the park - Cabbage was full of flavor, and corned beef tender. Will definitely order again!

Ku_vyiekbdeMleEgBRNCqA.text: I am not a picky eater but everything was not good. We're here on vacay. I get it's fight night but our service was not good at all.. I've had to ask 3 different waiters for a refill because our waiter only came to our table 4xs in almost 2hrs. I ordered a sirloin medium rare and came back extremely well done. And a white sangria, which tasted nothing like sangria. My boyfriend ordered chicken tenders and they brought him chicken tender wraps. Granted we said our complaints and the waiter did fix his mean and took my drink off the bill. Also Not once did a manager come ask us how or service was. We're from Vegas where they just opened a tilt a kilt, but because of our experience here, we won't be returning.

Xkw75nJx6MQRbZHlbK5EzA.text: First time at this pub. The staff was very friendly and helpful with select a dark beer choice. I had the fish and chip,the fries were Soft and not the best. Iwill return and try something different.

0VT1komnXsLYCs_djr_IFw.text: I liked the general vibe of the place =) The food was good, service was adequate, a bit noisy (but to be expected for a proper pub). It just didn't really knock my socks off, hence 4 (vs 5) stars.

_9tpxl1_urKa59PJN-HXrg.text: Great old time pub with superb food.

4-sCGurMQ8wiuZ_oaY38Dg.text: My husband and I and good friends from OC visited Scottsdale again in January for the many car auctions. Our 2 OC friends treated us for dinner at The Kettle Black one night. It was their first time there and they were as surprised as we were at the variety and the quality. It is much more than a pub. Good job Jason and great to see you and that The Kettle Black is thriving.

ZdPsvVbMH9rFoRjEmsv1jg.text: Highly recommend  Definitely a place to visit. Food drinks and service incredible. Steve, at the bar, is incredibly knowledgeable and very friendly. True Irish Pub with great service great prices and incredible flare... A True visit to not regret.

6uAoCBMsjhkvysCjfETing.text: My daughter and I were looking for a fun place to have dinner in downtown Phoenix. We were on our way to another place when we saw this one. We saw it was cute and seating was available. After ordering the truffle fries. Hummus plate and turkey burger we were filled with yummy food. To top the evening off we ordered the bread pudding (such amazing soul food)!

xoTPyOm3a2OCjs7uRMG72g.text: I came here with a friend for a drink...we decided to get cocktails, which was probably a mistake. We asked which cocktails would be in the sweeter side and the bartender recommended a couple cocktails, the John Denver and dear prudence. Well....these cocktails were pretty bad... Very strong and not very tasty. Additionally, they were on the pricy side for a cocktail that wasn't terribly delicious. This place did redeem itself in beer. They had a decent beer selection and we did a pretty killer car bomb. The car bomb cost less than the less tasty cocktails. My advice, come for the atmosphere and the beer...skip the cocktails.

PumSUM1Lf1YwNeagITWzkg.text: Where to begin?           First, this place offers exceptional customer service. The bartender, Stephen, was on top of it all night and made sure I never sat with an empty beer! The servers Mikeal, Misty, Kelsey, and Jen were phenomenal!!! They were all sweet, helpful, and personable, which is something that is too often missed with businesses these days. The GM and owner were not only present, but also serving the clients and both came to talk to me individually and ensured everything was going well!           Second, the food and the beer they had on tap were excellent!! I requested recommendations from the employees and each item was great; (philly fries, fish and chips, Stone IPA and Raj)!!!!             I will be traveling to downtown Phoenix frequently for business and they have earned a loyal customer each and every time I return!   P.S. They also have free wifi!   Thanks again, Kettle Black!

T8RqmbMZYYaCpEq7VKkDqw.text: This was awesome . First time the other night great service by Wes ....the short ribs and pork belly sliders we're amazing

Byk6jmKj_XGu6YoNDeY80g.text: Wonderful he in the wall. Not fancy, very comfortable. Wonderfully friendly bartender. I had the chicken club. So good! Garlic mayo, fresh avocado on sourdough bread. Packed with flavor. My friend had the Reuben an d lived it! Great fries.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Reuben
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9BXcGXX5ohDS_ag4y5H1pg.text: Wow this was amazing. The peppercorn steak was perfection and the service was the best. Loved the atmosphere and chance to just mingle and observe the local scene.

TlV7Ys8FggYPV0-Vh4qQXQ.text: This is a very mediocre place for lunch. They were out of pork belly sliders, the ahi tuna salad, and OUT OF GUINNESS?  I had the reuben sandwich and it was small and the bread was toasted with way too much butter. Nothing about this place makes it special.  A very underwhelming experience.

uGxIh30cnByYaMqCa7jvjA.text: Super cool bar. Madison was great behind the bar. I requested flank steak w arugula salad (chicken was offered on the menu) and they were fine with it. Salad was good as was steak. Just shy of a 4 for me. Had to round to a 3. Might go back for drinks tonight...

vzdp2KaKGT6WcdfcDypihQ.text: Stopped in to check out this place as it was highly rated. It didn't disappoint. Hipster crowd, cool pub atmosphere. Service was great. Ordered the crab cakes! Yum! Next time I'll order the fish and chips, looked amazing...apparently they use a tempura batter!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crab cakes with spring salad.

4KrUp2JCPeSpSiKSjryMEw.text: I live downtown and have walked past this place several times. I came in in a slow Saturday and was pleasantly surprised.  I sat at bar and the tender actually looked me straight in the eye. This is the type of place you go to if you want to become a regular Bc the staff is actually seeing you. Ordered the crab cakes and a beer. I like cold glasses, mine was not. A cold glass would have accelerated my review but the beer was cold. The crab cakes were awesome. Served with greens for $10. That's a $15 appetizer anywhere else. I like the staff. I felt comfortable. Good quality. Try it. You will like it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IMAXqqO-5pZa8qblP8hptA.text: Wonderful, fresh salad and crisp white wine served up with friendly service. Inside I felt like I was back in England with the dark, country pub feel. I highly recommend!

qKYtQqTXELkNEyX_9nfpwA.text: Great atmosphere, the scallops are to die for, they were so good we actually ordered an extra entree just so we could have a few more! Out if this world! The crab cakes not as delicious, not bad but a little mushy, hence the 4 stars. Will definitely go back for the scallops.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scallops with green pea mash.. beyond delicious !

APwlNDVHjn6mBT_Uo-y4eg.text: Coming to Phoenix once a year doesn't give me much time to try out many restraunts but this is one of my favorites. Great food and drinks, an amazing staff and fun atmosphere. Try the Bacon and Onion Burger and Ruben...great! The Corner Bodega is a great drink!

Rg1e6DeiVbJ61eH9Q1ze3A.text: Cocktails The kettle black 5/5 The rose and poblano 4/5 1st and Washington 4/5  Truffle fries 4.5/5  Bread pudding 4.5/5

Lbt3TVqfKoEpnFD0JHNSSw.text: Ambiance: A classy, upscale medium-sized Irish pub. Noise level is moderate enough to enjoy a conversation with your Guinness. Patrons consist mostly of 30's to 60 somethings, mostly white collars after lunch, Theater goers, convention goers, and post game fans. Lay out consist of a long bar, long bench table in the middle and booth seats along the wall.  Price: On the high end but this is a classy place so I don't mind if it keeps the place classy. There are plenty of places for the post college crowd and the hipster crowed in Phoenix.  Service: Always well taken care off. The owner keeps adequate staff to keep patrons glasses full.  Food:  Not your typical bar grub, menu includes nice selection of salads (seared tuna salad, Citrus Asian Chicken) as well as your typical favorites; Burgers, fish and chips etc.  Summary: A classy old school Irish pub where you can enjoy a gentlemanly pint!

8pUJF8Qcrh2KuWCpJc4tiw.text: This place is fantastic. The food is amazing and the service is even better. Ask Harrison (I hope I got that right!) about local beers (I'm from out of town) and talk to Billy about the food. I travel a lot for work and I don't usually go to the same place twice but we are considering a THIRD time because everything about this place is great. The atmosphere is welcoming and comfortable. The food and drinks are spot on. Check it out!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. California Club (in a wrap). Four Peaks IPA.

vxnyFqo4GY9Ksb9NNX10pw.text: Fun spot to go to after the game! It's practically impossible to get an uber around that time so I love that this place is walking distance. My server was super sweet and personable. I love the craft beer selection and the menu is awesome

UN6ZL4Qu66qdtrp071PePg.text: I had been wanting to visit this bar for a long time and it failed too disappointed. The kettle black is exactly the kind of bar downtown needed. Vibrant and charming. Food is great and the pints are equally as fantastic. Service is top notch too. This place is worth the trip.

MMWfNcd4dcAZM7HQIk7o5Q.text: Walked over from hotel for quick late lunch. Split sliders and fish and chips with my husband. Both were excellent!

BWCKzx2AV5u9SYgCjaWvog.text: We went for the kitchen and passed on the pub.  The kitchen definitely delivered on taste, portion sizes and presentation, loved the cutting board plates.  Three out of our party of four ordered beef burgers and raved.  I had the turkey burger and it was pretty good, a tiny bit dry but the onion roll grilled with butter and the other fixins rounded it out and it worked very well.  Truffle fries won the majority vote.  Never knew teenage girls would appreciate a sophisticated burger but they surprised me with their mature palates. Atmosphere, service and decor all added to the kitchens hands-work, one of the party of four did notice that there were not one black kettle in sight. Although we live a bit out of the way to be regulars, we would definitely  come back on another trip downtown.

emLIolP_Y7oovT9DZw6xAg.text: Awesome new pub that just opened downtown! $5 house wines, good beer selection, incredible pretzel appetizer!!!  Atmosphere: traditional English pub with modern flare  Service: superb Look for the big double red doors across from Hanny.  This will definitely be a hot spot. Competitive prices and hip vibes.

rxUwsR0qvxCwr3b7_asCCg.text: After an espically long day, Traveling  via Las Vegas. This place was an excellent find. The food selection was outstanding. We opted for crab cakes and pork belly sliders, delicious. It was a very peaceful comfortable pub. Nice choice of beers,good service and excellent hours for weary travellers. Open till 2 am Sunday. We got there at around 1030 pm. Great service.

Dg_QAAmvRUaryukBCad7vQ.text: Food very good. Service very bad. They charged us wrong after waiting forever for check. Manager did right thing fixing bill and giving us a discount. Just disappointed in service.

70xVjuIPywxB-4Mf2tTtRw.text: This place was really good, the fish and chips were great, and so was the turkey burger. We got the buffalo chicken fries appetizer and it was tasty but really spicy so if you don't like spicy, stay away! I customized my order for the turkey burger quite a bit and the waiter was very nice and helpful.

Dbf4PqXlWP5kKHKA5mY0BQ.text: So this review is in real time. 8:50pm on Sunday, February 19....  Sitting at the bar and watching the NBA Allstar game. Bartender is totally cool and on it. Welcomed me right away.   Had the bacon onion burger and a beer and shot of Jameson. Burger was meh.. Not much flavor and several inedible pieces of grissle that was a turn off. Presentation of burger was just not functional.  Seems like a fun place to come and get shit faced with friends but I can do that for much cheaper that my local dive bar.  Just a Meh rating here folks.

RPP6QIRcCiHRadMCmxMiaQ.text: Great food, great servers, great atmosphere. definitely going to come back! Alex was amazing!

rrMGrkPxq_XobW6mhB-PUA.text: Thank you Yelp family for leading me into this great restaurant for lunch. I came here and sat belly up at the bar. I've read great things about the fish and chips dish so decided to immediately order that. Wow! Everything was tasty and more! The fish was cooked perfectly and battered to perfection. The fries where fresh cut and crispy! Unfortunately, I wasn't a fan of the coleslaw but will definitely be coming back to try different dishes!

yjQZpvzHuK_SUkxAgxavCA.text: Great place to eat. Friendly & attentive staff. The fish was crispy, fries were fresh. Cole slaw was what you would expect. Stella was cold. Thanks guys.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and Chips

qz9L1pYMsom_AglL86Jx_Q.text: Searching for GF food options late on Friday after an evening Dbacks game is tricker than one would hope in a metropolis like Phoenix. Thankfully, Kettle Black popped up with the best Yelp! reviews around. After perusing the menu online, I gave them a quick ring to confirm that their kitchen was open late. From the moment we arrived to the time we left, we were treated as True guests. Despite walking in with six and the place being quite full, they were able to seat us quickly in a corner booth. The menu offerings are an inspired step-up from your typical pub-grub with reimagined flavors and delicious sides which really hit the spot! Don't miss their full bar and impressive draft selections. We're already looking forward to our next visit!

iie1dVan3OZ72ww_QTfY-w.text: I stumbled upon this place accidentally. I was originally trying to make my way to bitter and twisted a block or so away but saw this first as I exited the cityscape parking garage (I was only visiting for a couple days) so I just decided to go here instead and I'm glad I did. It's a really relaxed place with a great drink menu. I sat at the bar and started with the house drink - kettle black and an order of wings, half garlic butter and half spicy. The wings were nice and crispy but the sauces were nothing super special. The drink though, it was delicious. I got another drink called Broken China because the bartender recommended it and the steak salad with a spicy Caesar dressing. Both were great. It's kind of pricey but pretty much what you'd expect to spend at a bar on a night out. The bartender was really friendly too. Definitely recommend!

sRil1xUm4FGmnygNwXhT8Q.text: We love Kettle Black!!! We came in for some drinks and ended up ordering the pretzel appetizer. The cheese dip was amazing. Most importantly, the waitress was awesome and the service was great! Highly recommend!

CodwC63h6LfvOdtwu7jpnw.text: The atmosphere in was pretty laid back and seemed to have a large variety of beer and hard liquor. Turns out I'm not a fa of bear but still my friends have liked it. I was bar hopping when I discovered this place. The selection was great. Although they did have a full kitchen which was the main reason for my stop unfortunately it wasn't open.

tUqs1KmxpRsiMaoHvkv0iA.text: A colleague and I had a lovely lunch here. The service was good. The fish and chips was okay. The dessert was, according to her, blech. I'd probably give it another go, however.

5DYinwYlfmmLd5w8TGEOZg.text: First time in downtown Phoenix and had lunch here after reading the favorable reviews.  If you want a tasty burger, try the Bacon Onion Burger.  Delicious!!

U1gGcoD9KKwQCjqoHKTxmw.text: Random find using Yelp. This place is amazing!  Highly, highly recommend going if you're in Phoenix. Small place but huge attention to their environment and product. The waitress was extremely helpful in giving recommendations. We took her recommendations and weren't disappointed. The Buffalo Chicken Fries may be the best conglomerate of ingredients I've had for fries and the wings are better than any chain restaurant you'll spend your money at. Definitely a place where you have to go when in town.

tuP-2g6-EIHlAalIQbjzGg.text: Service was excellent. Atmosphere was good!  Come here and hang out.  We were not in a rush. Food was fantastic. For AZ, the crab cakes were good!!  Philly cheesesteak fries were great. Fish and chips tasted fresh and light. We spent the night in one of the pub style Windows looking out and had a great time. Bathrooms were clean

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LM-N-I4Qa7skFpOse54_mg.text: Party of 3, sunday 345 pm. We waited about 35 after we placed our order for our fries (app). And the meals took approx 43 minutes to come out. Service was ok, average . The place was clean and nice. Location was great. The food was slightly above average, but not great. My wife loved her black bean burger, I didnt like my sliders, and the mother in law liked the fries, but thats about it. Overall not a fan. I give it an honest 1.5 stars

hCZ5KNKtZC8xDApXwAL7Vg.text: Have walked past this place plenty of times, only to usually end up at Majerle's. Turns out that passing this place was a mistake because the food and service were great. Arrived during happy hour, but the drinks are only a buck off as my Guinness was now down to $6. They did have some good happy hour food deals, but we went straight to the main course. The burger, which I tried, was terrific (1st street burger?) with lots of quality toppings, but the Rueben might have stolen the show. They hand brine the corned beef in-house and then slice it and that is the start of the rueben. Usually, corned beef is chewy, but in this case it almost melted in my mouth and the blanket of saeurkraut and swiss cheese made this a very pleasant eating experience. The waitress with tats was very nice and also the fries are handcut and tasty. Small patio for people watching is a bonus. Good stop pre-game or pre-show.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get the Rueben
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great burger

9-MziKclTtjhi7e1YPycYw.text: Visited The Kettle Black for the first time this week and was pleasantly surprised. The ambiance and location are great, and the appetizers were very tasty!    Every restaurant has some growing pains along the way. Ours was some intermittent service delays - we had to get up from our seats and grab our own side plates, for example. But I chalk it all up the chaos of a grand opening and look forward to going back and upgrading my review to Five Stars when I try the entrees on the menu.

8bOZWNx6f_7mtXkVjVn1yA.text: Great food, atmosphere and location. My table got the mussels, wings, and pretzel, respectively. They were all excellent. The fish and chips is excellent, as well (I got that last time). Best in town, I can honestly say. Great food for a bar. They have stone ipa on draft, a big plus for me, an ipa lover. We were in a hurry to get to a show right after our meal and the service gratuitously was expeditious with our bill. I'll be back many times. Walking distance to anything downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mussels (with linguine)

5i6D5YRsB74wZid_jCVGLg.text: I've been here twice now.  The first time I was here, I had the bangers and mash.  The second time I was here, I had the bangers and mash -  they were that good the first time!  Any place with Guinness on tap, like this Pub, gets an extra star from me but this place would have gotten 5 stars even without the beer!  The place is large, clean and just noisy enough to have good energy without being so loud that you can't have a conversation.  P.S.  The bathroom was clean.

WlTIFYFiXneQWnqbVr0-UA.text: Met my friends here before the Cardinals vs Dbacks game.  Right next door to La Piazza PHX, right on 1st St.  Got a meter right in front ($1.25 per hour).  My friends were already there and grabbed a booth, so I met them inside.  Cool little place!  I'm cutting carbs, so I went with an order of their wings.  Normally, $11.00, but it was Happy Hour, so they were only $7.00.  Score!  About 10 decent sized wings.  I ordered them "extra crispy", and while crisp, I would have preferred another minute or so in the fryer.  Sauce was good, ranch was good, celery sticks were good.  For $7.00, it was a deal!  My friends ordered some mussels and the fish and chips.  It looked tasty, and they seemed to like it.  Service was on point!  There wasn't a minute that went by without someone checking on you or refilling your waters and what have you.  I was impressed.  Only bad thing I can say about the place is that the floor was SUPER slippery.  I headed back to the restroom, and almost slipped twice.  Walk SLOWLY!  Vibe was cool, menu looked great (when my diet is over, I would definitely like to check out some of their food), and the price was very good for happy hour.  I could definitely see myself coming back here before a game.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings!  $7.00 during Happy Hour.  They were tasty!  Good ranch and celery sticks, too!

x1qxE7m4HZ8ikes5lBBCdw.text: Hot tea was not hot, crab cakes seemed like a frozen variety and the tuna salad was absolutely horrible.   Pic below.  5 pieces of stale tuna on a bed of plain greens.  I think you would need to be drunk to enjoy this spot.  #beware

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gTQ2anR-XD2lHs9mQcOwvg.text: This place was awesome.  It is decorated in the old-fashioned British pub style and has lots of booths, seating and a bar.  Our server made us feel welcome as soon as we sat down.  We decided to do the lamb gyro and the fish and chips.  Both were great choices!  The Lamb gyro felt fresh and tasty in a different way.  The gyro meat was not the typical shaved shawarma meat you normally expect, it was more like a hamburger/ground beef style.  I had never had a gyro like this one before but I did like it.  The veggies and sauce were great too-everything came together well and it was served with your choice of fries, salad, pasta salad and i went for the pasta salad.  This was tasty!  My husband's fish and chips dish was also great.  Crispy fresh fish and nicely seasoned fries.  We left as happy campers!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4cHEqlc5jWqh10vWCpGR9Q.text: Great location, great decor, cold beers, and tasty burgers. It doesn't take much more than that to make this boy happy. And this boy was happy.   I stumbled into this place while in town for business, trying to escape the 100+ degree heat. Thank God it wasn't a mirage. It was a real oasis.   Plain and simple: I loved the cozy/rustic decor, my burger was great, and they have Magner's on tap. I was able to order a light beer, a dark beer, and some cole slaw to slap on top of my burger. It was all great and I left happy. The location is very convenient as well. I would swing by again if in the area. Thanks, Kettle Black.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is what happiness looks like.

cltTBDvUnS3hc6wTiYuWJA.text: This is a nice bar which reminds me of a Harry Potter type style. They have great drink choices but mainly a beer menu. The food was good. Fries handmade. Went during Phoenix fan fusion weekend and there was a special menu. Had the Mac and cheese with pork belly for $15. The flavor was good but $15 worth !? Reuben sandwich was good! Above average but nothing extraordinary.

TVnkhIWv6udjR0Ay1OE97g.text: Their liquor shelves are made of picture frames, need I say more? Okay okay, I also have to say it's refreshing have such warm comfortable place right in the middle of downtown. It's perfect for walking around the city and then grabbing a bite or drink. Speaking of which, the food is excellent. We got Philly cheese steak fries and chicken kabobs, of which we had plenty to snack on when we got home because the portions are generous.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken kabobs
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Philly cheese steak fries

0sfxPFVuQr5OM4IWEZUisg.text: Kettle Black is a cool Irish/English pub in downtown Phoenix with a good menu and nice happy hour.  The pub is well designed with a bar the runs the length of the restaurant.  My wife had the fish and chips (house specialty) and I went with the black bean burger.  The reuben also looked really good with curry fries.  The service was very good and the restaurant was within walking distance to both the basketball and baseball stadiums.  I will definitely be going back before future sporting events!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black Bean Burger

-ZwxKkcKAkaoApGbItIe1g.text: Service and seating right away. No problems to report. Husband had the Poutine and I had the Black Bean Burger. I'm ok with dairy and the waitress asked to be sure. Everything arrived promptly and was tasty. Good portions and reasonably priced. We were hydrating so did not imbibe but next time I'm downtown I'll try their drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar and seating area.

9f2OlJ36Yp3E5cJeOQZuLw.text: Favorite pub downtown. Amazing food and service. Love the atmosphere as well.   We go a lot before or after games. It's usually a little busy but have always been able to find a couple bar seats.   Highly recommend trying it out.

n8stvHd71vN8yx2LqQKVvA.text: Fish and chips was a solid pick.  Good selection of beer including Prairie's Vape Tricks sour.  Waters were constantly topped off leaving us quenched.  Our waited was attentive, and friendly.   The Irish bread pudding wasn't swimming in sauce (that sauce tho) like it is at there sister location Tim Finnigans,but still delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and chips oh my!
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vape Tricks
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wasabi salad is delicious!!!!

LL4lMeLhn8oAgjyFfgSBwg.text: One of the best American restaurant in downtown phoenix. Nice atmosphere and nice food. They are chicken dish specialists.
