Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KpdBoyQXdH_gWPkQ7wwDbw.text: Nice pub with a great menu.  I have frequented this establishment several times and the food and service are fantastic.   Last visit we had the pretzel and fish and chips. Both were winners. The pretzel was warm and melted in my mouth. They provided 2 dipping options on the side: mustard and cheese. The fish is one big piece that is beer battered and delightful. Cocktails are always winners here. This past visit I tried the Dear Prudence and it was refreshing. The service was great - thanks, Michael.  You are a rockstar!

8M4v-gUgg98bxudNmfjGhw.text: Yelp never steers me wrong!  Was in Phoenix for a convention and found this place to grab a bite for lunch.  It was awesome.  The booths in the back were comfy and service was excellent.  I ordered a benny blanco which was a delicious tequila drink.  Very refreshing.  For food I ordered the ahi tuna salad which was surprisingly filling.  I felt so healthy (the drink had cucumber, okay?) after eating all those greens.  Great meal. Great vibes. Would have loved to go back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sesame crusted ahí tuna salad
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Benny blanco

Js5-yVHKMbgl-qvx6Fqi8g.text: Great little place. Bar looks pretty decent with a wide variety of beer. Ordered the Ahi Tuna salad, yum yum! Could use just a couple more slices of tuna but for the price, was pretty happy. My husband ordered the southwestern chicken wrap. It was good, could have been a better with a little kick to it. Maybe served with salsa or a hot sauce. But both meals were filling. The waiter was awesome! The best part of this dining experience. He checked on us at least 8 times. Wow!!!  Like I said in the beginning, great little  place, so get there early because the fill up fast! Definitely one of my favorite places now!

7oQNqcxse4xnwumnv_eL5w.text: Super awesome vibe my kind of place great menu and pub choice drinks to quench . Love the decor

PmTEvJA3yUUtOE7a06d8tg.text: Friendly staff! Went here specifically for the buffalo fries as they are uncommon yet one of my favoritest foods :D  We also tried the bread pudding based on the servers recommendation and it was AMAZING, definitely should get it if you're a bread pudding or dessert person!

L_X9mgg_MFSYgJ3n4gAMtA.text: I tried the Reuben sandwich this time, it was awesome! I need to figure out where they get their sauerkraut because that is what made the sandwich.

YW1YnZDtKVCFn-vnhpqHxA.text: Food is incredible and the service has been great each of the last few times we've gone in for dinner. Love this spot!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Onion Cheeseburger
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon Onion Cheeseburger

yKZgQd74TKVSpO-j42VwJA.text: Really good food, nice atmosphere and great service. Tiffany, our waitress, was super friendly and a pro.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and chips. Delicious!
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum! Burger - bacon, cheese and onion.
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying lunch after visiting the Mummy exhibit at the Arizona Science Center.

dMjdP5YfQNrARuKZN_WRvw.text: This FIVE STAR review is for one of the servers at The Kettle Black. His name is Stephen. My car broke down outside of The Kettle Black on Wednesday afternoon while it was 110 degrees outside. I had my 7 year old daughter with me and we had to call a tow truck. While we were waiting outside in the 110 degree heat for the tow truck to come (which somehow took 90 minutes), Stephen saw us and came outside and invited us to wait inside where it was cool. He also gave me a glass of ice water and my daughter a glass of lemonade. I offered to pay and he refused. The world needs more people like Stephen in it! He made a bad situation a little more bearable. Thank you to The Kettle Black and THANK YOU STEPHEN!

I0a3cnH5qaLp5uJpxiza8g.text: This place is fantastic! My wife decided to celebrate her birthday here when we found it on Yelp. We had a pretty large party to seat but though they said they don't tend to do reservations on nights that a concert is going on nearby, they worked it out for us. We had a lot of appetisers, beers and dishes, and despite being completely packed that night, the staff was attentive, friendly and super on it the whole night. It's a wonderful pub to get food and drinks with friends and have a good time!

vawIzpAgbbS9LdnC8ol9AQ.text: What a great spot!  Tiffany and Michael were totally on the ball with service and very friendly.  The place has a great  bistro  charm and the food was great!  We had the blackbean burger and fish and chips.  Both fabulous and we'd order them again.  Give this place a try.  You won't regret it.

r8i7ycHVMhdav5tEUKha8g.text: Highly recommend! Their food is delicious, fast service and everyone is so sweet! Great environment, it's the perfect place to hang out and have some drinks. The customer service is great!! I had the the California Club sandwich and it was perfect. Definitely coming back!

sZE1drlrG95Y_QqCWJ_WZA.text: I am an avid go-er to the ballet and symphony and this is the best place to go after. Literally. I never get tired of it. The bread pudding is probably the most amazing bread pudding I have ever had. I love their crab cakes... like love love love.... The burgers are pretty decadent, but lacks flavor. I use a lot of the garlic aioli ... their fries are really good- I drown them in the garlic aoli or the curry sauce. Overall, it is always nice to end my artsy fartsy evenings there.   The interior is like an Irish bar had a baby with a hipster.  The food is like sporty gastropub meets young hipster chef.  So basically it is a young hipster chef who likes sports and is Irish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy

_VzzcA2DdZDuONCszwG0xw.text: First time here. I expected greasy pub food but was pleasantly surprised! Good portions. My wife had the arugula salad and I had the scallops. Excellent!  The host and service was excellent.

I5BlLoSJ1VqhqqaajUvRtw.text: Service was fantastic and so was the philly cheese fries. The fish n chips were honestly not very good. The batter was not light and a bit soggy.  I would still go back and try other things, but thought their "signature" item would be better than it was

b5mBhzIpoAcVNYEObGaByQ.text: The vibe is a hipper Seamus McCaffreys or George and the Dragon meets gastropub  It was super busy when we came in but we only had to wait a few minutes before the manager cleared some spots for us. Since we're talking managers. I've gotta message for this one. Man you've gotta chill! I think he chugged some red bulls, because he was around pretty frantically. Don't get me wrong, super nice, probably gave me about seven arm squeezes...but simmer down please.  We both ordered the tequila mojito cocktail equivalent. Way too sweet. Should've listened to the bartender when he said he didn't like the cocktail list. There was a lot of fried dishes on the menu. So we opted for the chicken kebab for a splash of healthiness. It was awesome the chicken was moist, and the green beans on the dish were drenched in heavenly garlic. The Pork Belly Sliders were not as grand. The meat was overdone and it didn't melt in your mouth like that fatty slider demanded. The sweet Chile sauce was a bit too sweet. I'll be back though, plenty more dishes to try.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Belly Sliders with pasta salad
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Kabobs

SeU3TiMjGf0sSaVtPYb6fg.text: Working across the street from Kettle Black has made my job very exciting. Exciting, first, to watch the exterior of this pub come together. Exciting, second, for offering another lunch alternative. Exciting. third, for being a spot I'll be taking people when showing off DTPHX.  So, I've been here a few times, traveled around the menu and must say I've had several good meals. While partial to the fish and chips, the burgers have been solid. And I simple LOVE the soft pretzel. Like, engagement ceremony love it.  While I've never had a drink here (I quit drinking last year), their selection of whiskeys looks impressive. But their water has always been satisfying.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly sliders with kale slaw. So good!
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly sliders and fries
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The southwest chicken wrap has a sneaky heat to it.

Rm_4-ByN58bXzFFA0y3STw.text: We wanted to try this place as we were here for business travel however after 15 mins of waiting we did not see any staff, we got our our menu but no one ever came to get our order. Terrible service

lUXHW-qvhttu6xsNxksbEA.text: Reuben and a pasta salad in downtown Phoenix for lunch.   Getting set for the Final Four...PUMPED !!

Q9H3J3FQ1EBc9M6I-PFwEQ.text: We stopped here for a quick bite before a Diamondbacks game, and had a wonderful experience. Great beer and whiskey selection, and we ordered the pretzel and the Southwest chicken wrap, and both were delicious. Their happy hour menu is awesome... I'm kinda sad we didn't order the philly cheese fries, because after seeing them brought out to another table, I had severe entree envy. We will definitely be back soon.

-17nUgQ-abKx3ZvmxBpUog.text: Environment: This place has a nice environment. Not too loud and good spacing.   Service: Our server was fabulous. He was enthusiastic and knows the menu very well. His recommendation were great as well.   Food: The food was great. Everything tasted fresh and coming out hot. The buffalo chicken fries was my favorite (recommended).   Price: The price of the entrees weren't bad. It was about $11-15. The buffalo fries seems to be a bit overpriced at $10 a serving. Granted the portion size was decent, it's hard to imagine the product cost to surpass $4 for them to charge $10.   Overall: The experience of this meal was great. Would probably revisit sometime in the future.

dNQMhH1f9p6i-N_iP7KUfg.text: In town for a visit.  Grabbed a beer and a snack. Beer was good and the philly steak fries were super tasty.

HQYBIvpAfzLcXD2r6hIJEg.text: Went in with really high hopes tonight. Bartender was incredibly nice. Guinness was really cold & good, and the Bavarian pretzel was awesome. Kitchen was moving SLOW.  The fish & chips were a disaster. Fish was overdone & so dry i could barely chew it. Fries were burned & under seasoned. Coleslaw was warm (because the plate had sat under the heat lamp for at least 10 minutes). I think it's time to change the oil in the fryer.   I really wanted to like the food, but I just can't.

Y3yLm3alO92us-98lZR-Pg.text: We really wanted to like this place but it was just so so.  Our server Alex was fantastic and very honest when asked his opinion on food and drink items from the menu.  However, the food was just ok and not worth a return trip.  The fish and chips was disappointing.  One piece of overcooked fish.

p7kEUPVesWrV-B0xw1pGdQ.text: Kettle Black is a great addition to downtown. Love the interior, and the food has all been great. Service at the bar is a bit better than the service at the tables.  Food-wise, I really liked the fish and chips. Obviously it's fried, but it still feels light and not greasy. I also liked the pretzel + cheese, but can you really go wrong with carbs and cheese? Pork belly sliders a solid choice as well. They look small but are super filling and flavorful. The chicken kebabs are good too, and a great option when you're trying to be a bit healthier.  I think the prices are also great considering the amount and quality of the food. Definitely recommend!

iBaiqn42itSlOAZ20pVRxA.text: Excellent food. service and atmosphere. Came in from Boston. Definitely a must location. You wont regret it.

eA4ZkhAgxjSeD-HVxNciFA.text: Overall: 7/10 round down to 3/5 stars  Food: 7/10 Good but not memorable   Location: 8/10   Price: 7/10  Service: 8/10   Came here a while ago on a business trip.  Close to convention center.  Food is average and good bar food, but nothing to rave and rant about.  If you're in town for a conference, good for a bite and drinks, but definitely not a must see.    Verdict: I'd come back if I was on business, but I probably wouldn't come back if I were a local

CxqpjRNOPbQItfv2iIga5A.text: Great service! Hubby and I had scallops and the potato leek soup. Very tasty and a great waiter -Wes  Thanks for an enjoyable meal!

ky1u9z20ic6BaFuwG3p2bQ.text: Great cocktails and awesome food ! Crab cakes at midnight far exceeded my expectations ! Misty and Harrison, y'all rock !

vD5F3iqiBEj69xk3BSME8A.text: We made the mistake of going on a Saturday night after the theater. The food was excellent but by no stretch of the imagination is this anything other than a bar this late in the evening. Extremely loud and raucous and a waitress who seemed very inconvenienced by having to provide food service. It would probably be an EXCELLENT place for lunch.

odIJkbl6sRvpGNbj71oarQ.text: A British-style pub. Good drinks. Good food. Cool decor. At least 5 TVs. Great place!

PE5FUrX6y27Brl50O52bwQ.text: Friday night post event find- right across from hannys.  Decorated like a dark "gastropub" this spot has a little patio area with a bar & booths inside.  The prices are reasonable for wine all under $9.  I also try the kebobs which are homemade yummy goodness.  Served over green beans the chicken kebobs also have onions, peppers, mushrooms, and tomatoes.  This dish is served with a corn salsa.  I would make this at home!  The food was served hot but I would have liked a minute or two more on the green beans.  Most of the chicken had a nice light char.  Our server Karen was very nice & helpful without being overbearing!  This is a gem in downtown Phoenix.

kw9JyGaGqozwWKiHcXp1zA.text: Love this place! Best food, best service, and amazing atmosphere! Great selection of craft beer as well! Every time I am downtown I make it a point to come here! Also truffle fries are to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some of the awesome decor here! Great bar!

xDtCOG7zRDbbWh_PGUUwfA.text: Holy hell. What a nice staff they have. From the bus boys to the manager, Jay, everyone was incredibly friendly. (I work in the industry so I know how important these good reviews are to some people) Brooke our server was extremely outgoing, friendly, informative, helpful, and suggestive. We had some delicious food; apps and entrees. Brooke was considerate with timing all our food out perfectly considering there were some larger parties at the same time as us and if our food ticket got stuck behind theirs, we might have had to wait a little while longer. She knew her stuff and I really appreciate that. This place is also a soccer bar (ManCity) so talk to their owner and get yourself in early if you're into that. Highly recommended for anyone looking for casual pub food with a fun atmosphere and a welcoming staff.

4gZjDOVlA3SeABj2cY09LA.text: First time here.  4 rating for the hospitality at the bar and the venue itself.  It's cozy with great music  We're craft beers drinkers and the staff behind the bar was extremely knowledgeable and offered us tastes.  Other venues near the downtown area scoff when you ask for a taste. One ale house charges after a few tastes.  I digress. Food was okay but not sensational but no complaints.  Enjoyed this visit.

_HQsOQlBAhLsyqNivXe_tQ.text: My husband and I were in Downtown Phoenix and we wanted to try a new place, the Kettle Black Kitchen seemed like a great place to get a beer. It was quite early so there was not that many people in the restaurant. The inside is very nice, there is a great Irish pub feel-like. The decoration of the place is well done, I love the bar itself.  We actually sat at the bar and ordered a Stella, the keg was empty (not the bartender's fault of course). We had to wait quite a while for our first beer, but no big deal. Then later on, my husband ordered a second beer and to our surprise the bartender pour the rest of the pitcher of Stella in my husband's glass.. She actually used that pitcher at least 20 minutes before to get the keg started, she poured all the foam in the pitcher ... Why would you serve that pitcher into a glass for a customer when it had been sitting outside for quite a while already.. Of course the beer was flat so my husband had to order a new one.. That's probably why I am not giving them 5 stars, not very professional. We got the Curry Fries, the fries themselves were very good however their homemade curry sauce tasted more like a soup..  Overall it was a nice place, we will be back for a drink and maybe try a main course or something. Hopefully, the Stella keg won't be empty!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Curry Fries &amp; a Stella. !

zikp07KRACICOhIZ8MuDSA.text: After two visits,  we've tried several items on the menu and all but one was great.(crab cakes were good, not great). Fish & chips great (one person had soggy fries, one has crispy), scallops were delectable,  burger solid, bread pudding scrumptious.  Server is a little hit and miss depending on how busy it is. Draft selection great. Only place on west coast to have Magners hard cider on draft!

cxk4Oe_kyuJ_1QRgUNEZyQ.text: I don't get this place.  It's cozy enough but that's pretty much where the good stuff ends.  They have a blackboard with  "Craft beers" but they really only have the standard Stone on tap and nothing too exciting in bottles either.  The food is pretty mediocre.  Not really would I consider gastropub fare.  The fish & chips came with the blandest coleslaw I've ever eaten and the chips needed life support.  I didn't even dare try what I could only guess was tartar sauce.  My buddy had a wrap which he described as meh.  The staff was nice enough but not nice enough for me to go back.

s-ShPG-glc9jsKsH3d8_GQ.text: Where do I start? The place was quite packed for a Thursday nite due to the Carrie Underwood concert, which I was also attending. My sister and I walked in and were immediately greeted by a cute, upbeat young man who pointed out a couple places that were available to sit. We picked the bar. We were served right away and given menus. So far so good. Then a gentlemen, the bartender, Jessy, came over and we ordered.... I guess "a lot of food" - okay - whatever- we wanted to try a few things- our prerogative. We had a good laugh about "how much food we ordered" which as an app and two entrees. Mr. Bartender, Jessy, who at this point, I decided to make small talk with because I wanted to know why he seemed a bit tense, glad I did because he does have a nice smile- when he shows it and makes a great cocktail. Don't be afraid of this guy - get him to smile and you are set... Anyway....Our food came and it was PERFECTO- loved it! For as busy it was, it was served quickly and hot. Key factors for me! We ate our food and only ate enough to save room for dessert!  Told Jessy we need MORE food and ordered our bead pudding! I laughed - he didn't - but whatever- it was served HOT and was amazeballs (yes- amazeballs) - we had one more cocktail... At which point the cute, upbeat young man that greeted us came by to ask how everything was- I told him how great it was that he was the social representative of the place- he informed us he was one of the partners. Made small talk with Harrison and told him we were quite impressed with our first visit here and added that even Jessy's mysterious personality was fun and we had fun seeing who could get him to flash his smile.   Alas, the final words on my review- definitely hit this place up when u are in Downtown - you won't be disappointed - the atmosphere, food, drinks and people there are great- This will be my go to place in downtown from now on! Lastly- make sure to say hi to Jessy and get him to smile!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish and Chips
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken Kabobs
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vPN8rmKfpcFu9lgVL831ZA.text: The food is great. That being said, I understand that this is primarily a pub/bar. The only issue I have is with the soft drinks. I enjoy going there for lunch, however it is not the time to have alcoholic beverages. They need to upgrade their soft drinks. If they are unable to used filtered water for the soft drinks the maybe have the option of having them canned or bottled. Even if I was there for an adult beverage I would probably stay away from the mixed drinks. But otherwise the food is excellent.

8fD3CBqrnvREhNx6H25ulQ.text: Friendly service, nice beer selection and a very large happy hour menu.  The food is a combo of on bar classics dressed up a bit -Philly cheesesteak fries - with some old standards thrown in for good measure - soft pretzel with grainy mustard & fish and chips.   Our waiter was super friendly, explained/knew the menu well & - had we not been to full- nearly sold us on the dessert.

4mCdi4MDaY6TQ1LVPT2stA.text: Food was great. Drinks were great. Atmosphere was great. It was a busy night at the restaurant and we still got seated and served in a timely manner.

9_-Fkgai9He_uPlnkxmmiA.text: Really giving 3.5 stars. We came in for dinner before a concert on 6/28/17. Service was a bit slow but friendly. I had the scallops which were delicious, and my husband had the fish and chips with garlic fries which was pretty good. The fries were very limp and soggy but the flavor was good. Decent beer selection, love the ambience. We would return.

iJxLG3jlKkvcZoKQldN9MA.text: Although we only had a drink the place was packed and had a great vibe!  Walking distance from The Valley and Hanny's and Talking Stick Arena.  The pretzel and wings looked awesome.

_m1oA7Ts5DHYqndGh7knBw.text: Was here over the weekend with a large party for my birthday. This place was one of the few places that could accommodate our group size and they were incredibly amazing. Great selection of food and drinks. I had their onion burger which was so tasty. Our server was on point. I really enjoyed our time here and I will be back!

jrPyukZ1CNqCYLskYgzMkw.text: Really enjoyed the black bean burger and my colleagues loved the ahi tuna salad. Beer list was great!

493_9uKtAaYkGUb446uWAg.text: This is one of my favorite additions to downtown!  From the drinks to the food to the service, everything is exceptional. It's a great place to watch some sports with plenty of televisions. I highly recommend the burgers, fish & chips and the pretzel. The mustard served with the pretzel is outstanding!    The menu is pleasantly simple and I haven't had a disappointing dish. Prices are reasonable on food and drinks.   Service has always been amazing here. Everyone makes you feel welcome and makes sure you're enjoying everything.   If you like a chill pub in a relaxing atmosphere with good food and drinks, definitely head to The Kettle Black!

Z1cYL_Xavav4aVRmkoa7OQ.text: Stopped here on the way to the game. Great Reubens  but I had the Ahi Salad and it was good. Great beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

w2Onfv-yVApRrhWRhZBl3w.text: Good food, good beer, good service, good atmosphere. There are so many great pubs in Phoenix that they tend to blend together after a while, and this place is another great pub. You won't be disappointed.

BRzeTpLDDj39sV3QOOrtpg.text: Any spot where the owner comes out to greet customers in the middle of a Saturday afternoon is off to a good start. Great whiskey selection, world-class Reuben, and friendly staff... I couldn't ask for more

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The absolute BEST reuben this side of NYC
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Knappogue Castle &amp; Guiness... Happy

-eQnGKDUwm311xZsF11nrA.text: This is the only place downtown offering happy hour on a Saturday night for folks like me visiting and staying downtown. I called Steve's grill right across the street from my hotel, the Hyatt to ask if they had happy hour, they hung up on me.

7DAlIQGW20VrAR-kxybXxA.text: Walked into such a good vibe. Michael was our server and he was on top of it! Always came through and gave us amazing service with a smile on his face. He recommended the Hop Rising and if you love IPA's it's a must try. We ended up ordering the steak salad; definitely one of the best steak salads we have ever had! Epic service with a great vibe!

lAISLtEDeUpPhhFlzeu9Mg.text: Cute little pub with great food. And try the Middleton Very Rare Irish Whiskey. The staff is also great.

3IhBkNwWL1Er0Axv9NamUA.text: We have been here several times and are NEVER disappointed. Amazing bartenders, great food, cool bar vibe. Our go to when in downtown PHX.

vXxV4C6l-f23drruzNzGGg.text: Nice find. Beer was cold, but if you have to order a mix drink ... make sure to order from the drink menu. They have a good selection of craft beers, but a limited selection of beer on tap.  F'n good tartar sauce with the yummy fish and chips. Unfortunately, the coleslaw was room temp.  Delicious reuben. Not greasy. Good fries.

TpiiCNSj9EvXumXJXcS0ww.text: Loved this place ! My wife and I were in Phoenix for a Diamond backs game and stopped here. It has the feel of an Irish pub but the food was better than your average bar food. I got the pork mac and cheese and it was great. Great location too as it is a 5 minute walk to the baseball/basketball stadium. If you are in Phoenix definitely stop by !

NQnDTtbhzdbs9wbvc9wcoQ.text: This Irish Pub/restaurant is okay, just okay. Nothing special on the scale of places to eat lunch in Phoenix.  We dinned here three days while staying across the street at the Renaissance Hotel. The first two meals were good. The third day I ordered an arugula salad which was brown and tasted old. I ate a few pieces of blue cheese and candied nuts then pushed it aside and shared my husband's lunch with him. When the waiter took the full salad away I mentioned the greens were brown, limp and old tasting, to which he replied "oh". So I repeated myself. The greens in that salad have gone bad. So he said "okay I'll let him". When he came back with the bill I asked him if he had told the owner/chef and he said "yes" and started to walk away. I said "what did he say, too bad"? The waiter said "yes".  Suddenly I was reminded of the show "Bar Rescue". Grossed out completely, I wondered how complaisantly the rest of the kitchen was being managed.  Let me say, the greens on my husbands side salad (not arugula) looked very fresh. Upon making the salad, I don't know why the cook didn't offer me the fresh greens in place of the arugula. Funny how a restaurant/bar owner can get so hung up on himself that he would risk a bad review and "surprise kitchen inspection" just to save his 3 dollar cost of goods in making it right with the customer. We will not return on our scheduled trips to Phoenix.

o-u8fiP70j34SXu_1nfjeg.text: Great selection of beers, whiskey, cocktails, wine and food. Love the atmosphere and the service is top notch. The music was on point too. We will definitely be back.

rqGmk37ctPPudRMQV__OsQ.text: Burger was great. Bartender offered a good scotch recommendation. Great service. Definitely go back.

joSirhdkg1Tq6PToetHQvQ.text: Steak salad was one of the best I've had.  The meat was cooked perfectly and the spicy dressing was super delicious.  This place has a great ambiance- it's unique for downtown.  Although it was busy for a Monday the service was excellent.  All in all a really positive experience!  I'll definitely come back.

raAhWSn4LbrNwgTBBPfdUA.text: Visiting town. Kettle black was close to the hotel. Busy place but got a seat at the bar. Friendly staff. Quick service. Good food. Definitely recommend

3lGAedEKtMwKlFT18-zi-Q.text: Warm atmosphere, friendly staff, fast service and good food makes this cozy pub a great place to spend an evening with friends.

3hCn72AflMBKmZJQ7CtYJQ.text: We went for lunch today, when downtown Phoenix was pretty much empty. Happened upon this place, and wow! The Philly cheesesteak fries are off the hook! Best fries I've ever had. Waiters were attentive but not over-bearing. Will definitely be back.

ckmy7xxKWWZnq5ecmtFmWw.text: Perfect for after a long day at the Convention Center. Pork belly sliders were amazing. Vibe was bar, relaxed, could enjoy some privacy in the booths that had plugs for charging up our phones (which we desperately needed!). Service was friendly and prompt. Happy to have found the place.

3gmV94CM0sV5Advxuwk8tQ.text: Outstanding service at the bar. They bartender was very friendly and super attentive. The fish and chips were top notch. Highly recommended.

nzDw0KnX5k0aPlTwu8vC1g.text: Food was great. Service was exceptional. A really cool find. Hip hop magical pub, nothing like it.

pac-1SXjd5gQM4eq3LxSHg.text: We got in late and stumbled across this place.  It was great.  The bartender was friendly and easy to work with.  Food was really good.  We got burgers, wraps and a Caesar salad with grilled chicken.  Would I go back .... yes!

T9ZSST4OoPDJFGJMQXMuSA.text: Love this place. Close but not too close the the stadium if your attending a game downtown. We sat at the bar enjoyed the perfect pour of Guinness. We had the crabcakes they were so good. Fresh fish & a great side aioli. Since we're heading to the ball game we didn't have dinner but all the good looked amazing we will be back. Service was great we went back for another beer after the game.

Fnj4bLZFFye-G0nVVW8OFQ.text: Really great pub style! Waiter kept sitting next to me repeatedly...like 6 times. But I enjoyed the place and food very much

NfJcfnlXnmytgO-IeXggcQ.text: Food was delish. The Buffalo chicken French fries are insane and the service was great. We will 100% be coming back here. So many beer options.

DFzhBRnYjNenJ0_LBr95Qg.text: A great little detour on our road trip.   We got in around 4pm which was the perfect timing for a Saturday night; they seemed to fill up very quickly after that.   The food was very good. We started with the truffle fries (we weren't going to get them but then we saw someone walk by with them and we had to try them) and they were very good. Nice and crispy! We got the steak salad and the bacon onion burger, but very good as well. The salad was the perfect size if you were thinking about that bread pudding which we highly recommend. That bread pudding alone is reason enough to stop through.   They did seem a little under staffed for a Saturday, but everyone was very friendly and helpful when they stopped by our booth!

xtvKKTW-XE4R8fSYS1pItg.text: Ice cold beer, great food, great staff and its a clean establishment. Just stoped for a quick drink ended up finding a downtown favorite.

0gOPQUFhrPk89OothLyJCg.text: This a great place!!! Went in for lunch during a break in our conference at the convention center. Service was great, we needed to get in and out within an hour and it was done. I ordered the pork sliders. The meat was tender and full of flavor, you could taste a hint of wasabi but not hot or overpowering. We also got a pretzel, soft and chewy. Great for lunch, great food, nice decor and great service! Wholeheartedly recommend!!!

ohcbCPkRef9L87wOhfD7FA.text: Awesome happy hour! My husband and I were in town for a conference and stopped in for drinks. Draft beers were $1 off and well drinks were $4.50/each. We decided to order a Bavarian Pretzel ($5/each), which was delicious, and ended up staying for dinner. I had the California Club and my husband had the Ruben. Both sandwiches were great! Bartenders are very friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this place if you are in Downtown Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy hour drinks. $1 off draft beers and $4.50 for (STRONG) well drinks.

CGUxKCNMs-JNIcgurfHpFQ.text: Very friendly service, it's a good place to come and unwind after work or during work. We enjoyed our meal.

XLqlPcabqUvudcpD1r_V2Q.text: Very Kind! The food & service was great! But even more, I had accidentally left my credit card there & couldn't retrieve it for 24 hours. They were so kind & honest! When I picked it up the bar tender again was super pleasant! I appreciate caring & kind people. I will remember this restaurant/bar & return when traveling back to Phoenix

y_omAthZrUthqjNOleGdVw.text: Sweet Chile Wings were probably the best wings I've had. Great service despite being packed due to the Final 4. Chicken sandwich was also good.

H3VSQAgKuygKOpmgsaLy9A.text: Awesome Irish Pub w amazing food. Fund n Chips awesome n the Phily Cheesesteak fries r the bomb! Billy is n AMA big bartender n will not steer u wrong!

QY5s563_7rF5jzWY_IpOYg.text: Great bar!  Some different cocktails and a nice whiskey collection. Had the cheesesteak fries and they were so effing good. Saw some of the other food which also looked tasty. Friendly attentive staff. A definite stop next time I'm downtown.

8DtAOGT0EB73IpReGgJxhQ.text: This Phoenix place was OK as a gastro pub. The food was good. The draft beer selection was a mix of local and other brews. We came for happy hour on a Friday evening. The music was fairly loud rap music until 6:00pm, then changed to a more middle of the road selection after 6:00. The service was very good.

2CktkVGnxdGqUaRO7ZNzsw.text: Great service, food, and atmosphere! I have been to Ireland many times and I lived in Phoenix for a few years and can totally say this is the closest it gets to an Irish pub in the valley. I would totally recommend it to anyone that wants to have a good meal and a great time! I hope they keep it up!!

12lUQzoQ4YjEZ2LlBOieSQ.text: My wife and I loved this place - excellent food, wonderful service, and funky atmosphere.  Very close to Talking Stick, Comerica Theater, etc.  We will be back!

aEIjxuBbwjJLq_FcF1ketw.text: What a great place .  Service was excellent and very friendly staff.  Got there a little late and had some of there fantastic appetizers Looking forward to going back again.

nGfiUMYqDaEUVxsnGYFtJQ.text: Slowest. Service. Ever. Seriously. The food is really good (corned beef & cabbage soup, curry fries), but you literally need to wait an hour for it. An hour. Maybe more. Server didn't apologize or recognize that it took forever. Holy cow we waited SO LONG! Other table with a lot of people warned us. Place isn't even that big. I hope they figure out the timing soon. Like I said, the food was really good and was what prevented them from 2 stars. It's a Monday, btw.

91kXA7wtVajjr9t7jzZ0HQ.text: Posting again because I'm pretty sure the owner's brother flagged my review. Two days ago me, my wife, and 2 year old were told we had to leave after we had sat down. Waiter said that they "technically turned into a bar" at 10pm and no children were allowed. It was 10:20 just after a Phoenix Suns game. I called ahead to make sure they were still serving food not at all thinking that I needed to ask if my daughter was allowed in the restaurant. Anyway, as soon as the waiter started in with this BS speech we bolted for the door. Curious, as I have never been told to leave a restaurant because I have my daughter with me, I googled the Arizona liquor laws. Sure enough, turns out Kettle Black was just discriminating against parents with kids. Their "not good for kids" description really means "stay out if you have kids." I've had a Yelp account for many years now. Obviously, there have been other instances where I did not receive great service. This is the first time I have ever been motivated to voice my displeasure.

pRYTkVqJEtSH7DwZoL-vsg.text: This is a great eatery with a fantastic bar feel... or is it a great bar with a fantastic eatery feel.  I don't know.  The Samson special was perfectly cooked and was almost out shined by the balsamic vegetables that came with the meal.   I highly recommend this bar/eatery for meals and drinks.  In fact, I brought associates to hang out here the following evening!

3i-NElam7bfuFh5UXf1_lQ.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch and my oh my- what a great suprise!  The fish and chips and Ruben were all amazing.  Will be back for sure

RPN7kePgQAEA4oXfOVtp7A.text: My fiance and I had tickets to see the Symphony so we decided to stop by for dinner before since it was so close to the symphony hall downtown. We were greeted very friendly and seated exceptionally fast. We both ordered a Guinness and I suddenly felt like I had been transported to an English Pub! The burgers we ordered were fantastic, and the buns (not sure if they're made there or not) were amazing! The ambience and overall vibe of this place is groovy and fun, we will definitely be coming back and recommend it to anyone looking for a cool place to pop in for a brew or a tasty bite to eat!

2Cb4AONaALIB007zjiiU2Q.text: We eat downtown very often and this is one of our favorite restaurants. The portion sizes are perfect for the price. The food is always prepared perfectly and we've never been made to wait too long. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive to the customers. You have to try the bread pudding!

2DhZMPm1ygp-Vw9MVe1rQg.text: I met up with a dear friend tonight for dinner & drinks.  We get together often and it was her turn to choose.  We arrived at 6 and the joint was jumpin'!!! We found a booth and settled in to get caught up.  Our waitress helped make choices from the drink menu.  I chose a bourbon-based concoction and my friend opted for something gin-based.  Both were delicious.  We ordered main courses; I went for the fish & chips and she chose the skewer with veggies.  Both dishes were yummy and nicely prepared.  This place is nicely laid out with lots of wood and metal accents. There is ample parking snd the prices are reasonable.  We met one of the owners outside.  His name is Harrison and he is lovely, as are the staff inside.  I'm looking forward to going back for poutine! This is a nice little pub and I wish them great success....

eXjailQzKhzTaYozKXafpA.text: Great environment, awesome staff, food and drinks are on point. Love coming here to hang with friends and family, always have a great time. Must have the pork belly sliders and garlic aioli fries.

GZsOjSfPwt3iPl64QjkeHQ.text: Great food and service. Clams were some of the best I've ever had, we ordered another.

8mRfL0IScQ7VRxrxFrJaSg.text: Stopped in before the symphony. Close by friendly atmosphere. Chicken wings were delicious.  Fish and chips classic and tasty. The steak salad was pretty good the flat iron steak was cooked to a nice medium/rare  a lot of lettuce and ratio of corn and roasted red peppers were good. Our server was friendly and gave me some insight to craft beers. Had me taste a couple to get an idea of what I was looking for.  The bread pudding was great and our.waitress made a fresh pot of java to make it complete. Would definitely go back again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread pudding
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak salad
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vBd9KpbdOmplpjnS4H7L8A.text: Ok, I'm from Los Angeles so I have to admit I'm a tad pretentious when it comes to good food. I've had plenty of burgers here trying to find the one Phoenix beefy, gourmet masterpiece that is a GastroPub burger and I've finally found my edible Unicorn. Rehab Burger, Delux and Rocket Burger have been my top until now and they do a fairly awesome job (top mention to my Main Slab Rocket Burger) but this place blows them out of the water. Tender, juicy, flavorful and complimented by the freshest toppings, this burger is THE BEST BURGER IN ARIZONA. If you feel differently, feel free to message me because if you know one better than here I have to try it to believe it.   For those from Los Angeles think along the lines of Father's office, Black Sheep and Vaka burger. Yeah, that good.   My boyfriend had fish and chips and I was surprised at how delicious it was (I don't usually like fish). It was ridiculously fresh. And the soup of the day (corn beef and cabbage) was magnificent. Honestly, not one thing we tasted was even kind of a dissapointment. Everything was so flavorful.   As for everything else, the ambienece was great, the beer was fresh and hoppy and the waiters were sweet as hell. Our waitress didn't even seem bothered by my constant indecisiveness (everything looked so delicious I changed my order a couple of times).   This is going to be a new regular spot for us. It cures my case of the homesick and then some.

LknB-gOoiVvELNQhLKycFA.text: Ordered fish & chips. Fish was like leather, way over cooked, service was less than average, fries were decent , slaw was average. Travel to Phoenix for business, but probably won't be back

x4-CSgVLXGxxtCrmzALHMg.text: We were in town for a volleyball tournament, and stumbled across this place. We walked in just to take a look at the menu and knew we'd be back for dinner. Tom and Harry run a great operation with great service and delicious food. It may be the middle of the summer, but I couldn't resist ordering the Guinness braised short ribs--and it was no mistake. So delicious! All four of us ordered something different, and none of us were disappointed. If you're anywhere nearby--definitely check this place out.

OBwvexgglInxwzSBqQuR1g.text: Very nice staff however the drinks and food that i had were not that great....I had the worst mojito ever, just tasted bland. The chicken wings were not seasoned, bland without the sauce...very dissatisfied after reading the reviews claiming that it was great. I did not complain but will not return!

tOZ04W5N-yhQIqADyLMKqQ.text: Sorry Kettle Black.  You won't ever see me again.    An "Irish Pub" that offers Philly Cheese Steak?  Didn't want to even try it.    My friend ordered a Rueben Sandwich would have sent any True Jew running into the streets screaming.  Gordon Ramsey, where are you when we need you?   Want a really good Rueben?  You can find it in the most unimaginable and unlikely place in town - Village Inn.  A great Rueben sandwich.  I ordered fish and chips.  Dreadful.   At least it was cod.  The lump of fish  should have been sliced thin before battering and frying.  The batter did not stick to the fish and it was a chore just to try to get it into my mouth without it falling off my fork.  I think this is also an indication that the frying oil was not being hot enough.  The fries were good though after being doused with salt and malt vinegar.  One of our group ordered Crab Cakes and loved them.  OK, one brownie point.  Another ordered the Ahi Tuna salad.  It seemed OK but was nothing special and could have been duplicated in over 100 Phoenix eateries.  Did they offer a large selection of craft beers?  Yes, but after the mediocre food who cares?  Not me.

U_0QGLhKXqc_0xyzqeCbXA.text: Cute pub with lots of choices in beers. I had the Kettle Black Burger and it was delicious. The meat was cooked perfect, the topping tasted great and the bun was so soft! My husband had the fish & chips. The fish is cut fresh there, the tater sauce was homemade and fantastic and the Cole slaw too was fresh and flavorful. The only disappointing part was both of our French fries were cold and soft from the moment they were served. Other than that the service was great and staff friendly.

8e03pZeW8en-KRlYyqCA3Q.text: We were trying to find a place to eat during our daughters volleyball tournament and found this amazing place. My husband and daughter both had the burgers which were great! I tried the Ruben and it was awesome! Try the Magners cider you won't regret it! I felt like I was back in Ireland at a pub. Great service and atmosphere!!

4DMp-cUPTFs4YqBmKV-5wQ.text: I've been here for lunch many times since I work just across the street, but today after work the girls and I came for happy hour. I have to say, Mikeal was our server and he was AMAZING!! Super friendly and an all around great person! I've never had a had experience, everything and everyone has always been great. Tonight Mikeal made it even even better!!

GLd22JhmiBD9PSX4agIWGA.text: Great! Interior, food and staff. Menu had plenty of options. Spinach salad with chicken is what I got and it was excellent.

VxmzSSCjKIhzXv5iEF7CMw.text: Service was really slow. Ordered a bowl of soup. The bread served along with the soup was too small ( half the size of a sandwich bread.) that too just one slice. I asked for more bread was 1$ + for another slice. After 30 minutes it was time to leave and noticed the order of bread never came. We were done with food and asked for check. She brings check, kept the bread wrapped in foil on table didn't say a word and walked away. I haven't seen such a terrible service in my entire life.  The food was terrible too. We ordered southwest chicken wrap and blackened chicken sandwich. Both were bad.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kfI7KfVx8t4_PX7CS3rwqw.text: My first visit was after midnight and the kitchen was closed.  One of the customers was speaking highly of the food so I had to come back to try it.  I met one of the chefs and one of the co-owners.  They have an good selection for Irish, Scotch, and Bourbon and draft beers.  I ordered the 1st Street burger and the crab cakes.  Both were amazing.  Well worth the trip back.

yTxsmOIHYIyeDm51M9n-1g.text: I've been here twice now, visiting my daughter at ASU. Service and food excellent, great Irish pub atmosphere.

px-ABFJEsu7eay17uAvpqg.text: Working in Phoenix for the next few months, scouting downtown found kettle black.  Menu looks good went in to try the fish and chips.  Chips were crispy and perfect.  Fish was golden, crunchy and delicious.  No need to tartar sauce or malt vinegar.  Tried it with both, complimented well.  Fish was light and fluffy not too oily.  Service was friendly, I went for a late lunch so not too busy.  Atmosphere was comfortable.  I imagine this would be a great place to enjoy a pint.  Check it out.  Only drawback was the cobbler on Yelp was off the menu may head back to try it again.  Enjoy!!!

T7Rt8veAKrAuPF6iWG2iEQ.text: Sara(h) our server was very good (we had 7 people at our table). Irish stew and pork belly Mac and cheese were really good.  Yelp reviewers didn't disappoint again.

w_JGGr52y4n5Fj_bT3Itcw.text: Delicious! Good beers on tap. Good service. Good prices.  Excellent Reuben. I'll be back to eat more and drink more!

4FN42kjsz5CzCxT-Sc0odg.text: Beautiful place  loved the decor and picture frames for the bar, very unique. the atmosphere is a little dim but perfect for the mood they are going for. very relaxing & welcoming spot.  they have a normal draft beer selection, not to crafty but it has a couple odd balls that were good. i tried the cucumber gose by black market, it didn't disappoint. my friend ordered a single whisky, it was nice and fatty.  the burgers, both turkey and ground beef were delicious. the fires were a bit sogged down, but at least they were super fresh.  all in all this is a great place for food and drinks, i will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey Burger
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger.... no LT

ImZJkxxyAs759MOVwpSsfg.text: The chicken wrap was delish. It paired really well with the garlic aoil. Should've taken the photo before I ate it. Oh and with the sour crush beer, this made it best meal for me tonight.

z3WgzucU7d2mu394kvF3dQ.text: I went here for dinner during a conference with some of my colleagues. We were told they don't make reservations for less than 10 but there should be seating when we got there. However, we were told to wait at the bar when we came because everything was full (although it wasn't). Then we sat at a table and about 5 mins later, we were told there was a reservation for that table (which sat less than 10) in the next 45 mins so we could either sit there and have to move when the reservation comes or we could move to another table now. We moved to another table which actually was someone else's & they ended up leaving because their space was given to us. The service was very slow. We seemed to have to flag our server down when we needed something.   The food was really great though. Our table ordered the Philly cheese steak fries and hot wings. They both were excellent. I ordered the wasabi chicken Caesar salad, which was also great. I'm a Caesar dressing snob and they definitely delivered.   We came towards the end of happy hour and were able to get some drinks in, which ended up being pretty good. Our server was not very knowledgeable of their drinks or that it was even still happy hour!   The prices are fair. The restaurant itself is pretty small. Overall, the food saved this experience because otherwise I would have left due to the poor service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wasabi chicken Caesar salad
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tequila &amp; OJ - happy hour drink. $4 well drinks
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Philly cheese steak fries

eTDpsw0ZhCOUnhvWWKnKsw.text: I wish I had a better experience. The food was not that great. We ordered the crab cakes, fish and chips, scallops and another dish that I can't even remember. The prices were on the higher end and I was really hoping to love it, but we didn't. The service was great, however. Sadly, we won't be back.

JAGvzPnH33TRhHn9-bwqmA.text: Always the best staff and quality food. Come here for a good time. Don't miss the happy hour specials!

ErQg0UpQhWKSVpdva6m-Fw.text: Great urban downtown place to eat! Great friendly waiter and the burgers + pretzel bun were awesome!! Only issue is it smelled pretty musty, but I suppose that is expected as it's a pub, but got used to it pretty fast.

Eiw4eR7uWP-C9Oq-7WJlHQ.text: Nice friendly place. Looks like a real pub. Decent beers and food was good too. Good service and very good fish and chips. Worth a visit if you are downtown.

-ePXTjBklDPJuP_SnuNKLg.text: So happy the fiance & I checked this place out last night. Absolutely feel the British vibes immediately. Big plus if you're a big HP nerd like me. Bartender was warm/friendly & made our drinks nice & stiff. Will be sure to have dinner next time. The food looked amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ULjGzUOkQ5KrAhuct7mK2A.text: Great atmosphere; great service, friendly servers, delicious food and great drinks!   Tried the pork belly sliders and they were phenomenal.  Great place to stop in in downtown Phoenix!

xddw9yQ8Pt7TWCMHU6SLRg.text: Service wonderful, very friendly and efficient.  Food, both of ours - short ribs and fish and chips just okay.  All though the fries, chips were a soggy, greasy mess - yuck.   I will come back for a cocktail and the fun energy but, likely not for the food.

6DxIZCJ2vc4K8zl1uakSIA.text: Came in to meet family for a quick bite before D-Backs game on Father's Day and didn't know what to expect. Turns out this place is Fantastic! Not only was our wait staff very friendly and kept on top of everything, their food recommendations were spot on and the rest of the food we ate was just as good. We will definitely be coming back. Thanks for making it a great first impression!

tVtwIn_5vz7yJHDXUxo_TQ.text: Atmosphere and service they get 4 stars, food brings it down a notch for me. I sat at he bar and the bartender promptly greeted me, very nice guy. He let me try the local brews they had on tap before I chose. Both were very good, it was an IPA and a scotch ale.  I decided on a burger over the array of sandwiches. I have to be honest, it was bland, very bland. It sounded like it'd be bursting with flavor but I don't know, there was nothing to it, it had no flavor in anything. I had to throw a fair amount of ketchup to just get something out of it. I was really underwhelmed. The fires were very good. I felt like if they would have added some seasoning to the burger ingredients it would have been wonderful but it was like salt and pepper went missing. I was really sad because it looked and sounded really good.  Now, I will say the place itself is a cool pub atmosphere, it seemed like a fun place to throw back some beers, but the food just fell flat for me.

zuLeFkOTmHIjI88jdpyiww.text: Came here and watched a game with a couple buddies. Decent happy hour and great food. Would definitely go back!

6kkJV5oPnPURw8jwC1Bi8A.text: Tonight's goal was to indulge a little and then head to the Orpheum Theater for an event. We stumbled on this gem my husband had heard of before. I was a bit cynical since I wanted to eat across the street. There was a small patio outside but we wanted to be indoors.   The minute we walked in I knew the hubs had made the right choice. It's our kind of place. There were booths, a very nice area, wood in enough places to add warmth and a cozy factor. From the get go, it just felt good to be there.   Our server was quick to come over and offered a sample of a craft brew from a local brewery I'd never heard of. Tasty!  We were a bit early for dinner so we ordered from the lunch menu. Nice variety here. Salads, sandwiches, and more.   Full disclosure: I am NOT a sandwich person. Not at all. Burgers yes, sandwich no. But, the chicken sandwich on a ciabatta roll with avocado, bacon and some delicious mayo concoction on the side was absolutely the BEST sandwich I've ever eaten. I am serious. Every mouthful was pure goodness. The best!  My side salad was fresh and the bleu cheese dressing and large chunks of cheese which I promptly savored. Yum!   Another server tempted us with the bread pudding. Hmmm...do we dare? Remember I said indulgence was the goal, so glad we caved. Deliciously decadent and we loved every single bite.    I think The Kettle Black will now have to be on the list where we take out of town guests and it will be our our regular list too!  Great service, cool place. A new date night place for us for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna salad. Looks awesome.
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Long list of craft brews.
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great ambience. Love it here.

KBrdD8umw5g-YvHBQURL4w.text: Very friendly people. Great verity of alcohol. Very good prices of food and drinks. Great vibe very relaxing. Interesting outside seating.

84hwOAAKWQ84lClyO8hZcQ.text: We had originally stopped at another bar restaurant for dinner but I felt like I didn't want to eat there and saw that this place was right around the corner so we came here instead. Huge improvement!   We start sat ourselves at the bar and the bartender helped us which I was impressed with because he was also filling all the other drink orders for the bar as well. We ordered two beers which he poured immediately and helped us with some questions with the menu. We ended up ordering the pretzel and the black bean burger. The pretzel came with a cheese dip and a crushed mustard seed dip. What I liked about the pretzel was that it stayed soft even after the pretzel had cooled off. Usually, they get hard. The cheese was phenomenal. It was creamy and a restrained cheese flavor that was good. I also dipped my fries into it. I'm not a super mustard person so not comments there. The black bean burger was good. The patty was nice and moist with really good flavor. I would describe the overall flavor of the burger as comparable to a really good meatless chili. I love meat and I enjoyed the burger so there's that. I really liked this place and would definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black bean burger
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vm_wyz48PCHKBbUXnadOGA.text: Great food. No seriously. Great food. Close to the convention center great place to meet up after trade shows and work days. The service is very friendly and prompt. Highly recommend if you are in the convention center area

yxP0tM3U0y3szIG3uzDOtg.text: How to describe The Kettle.  Its owned by a couple of Irish ex-pats, but its not an Irish pub per se.  The contemporary Victorian style interior might trick you into believing this could be a British pub, but no its not that either.  There's plenty of TVs at the bar, so is it a sports bar?  However you wanna describe The Kettle, its most certainly a pub unique to Downtown.  I had the The Kettle on my to do list for awhile and I figured I'd come in the middle of happy hour on a Tuesday, expecting a light crowd and a chance to soak it all in.  The Kettle is located next door to La Piazza PHX (an excellent Downtown pizza joint) just north of Washington on 1st Street.  When I came in just before 5pm, I had expected to grab a seat alongside a light afternoon crowd.  To my absolute astonishment, the place was packed.  Kettle's convenient location to much of the Downtown work crowd would at least partially explain this, but a full house in a restaurant that seats upwards of 80 people?  On a Tuesday?  Before 5?  With no concert or game scheduled that night?  Holy moly.  I actually arrived just as a seat at the end of the bar was opening up so I fortunately didn't have to wait.  Once planted in the corner, I went to work.  As I said, the place is owned by a couple of Irish ex-pats (Jimmy Culleton and Tom Montgomery), and they clearly were looking to put their own spin on a European-style pub.  No bangers and mash or corned beef and cabbage here, no sir (okay there is fish and chips, but I digress).  In fact the grub here overwhelmingly American in influence.  With bar food classics like pretzels, wings, and fries with different toppings, as well as main dishes like burgers, chicken sandwiches, and even mac and cheese.  The beer selection for the day is on the chalkboard up front and their cocktail list is available upon request.  I started with the The Kettle Black's signature cocktail.  Appropriately named...The Kettle Black.  Bushmills Whiskey (from Ireland of course), Cointreau Noir (basically an orange flavored French Cognac), Orange Juice, Lemon Juice, and Cinnamon.  Refreshing drink with no almost aftertaste, though I'll admit the strength of the alcohol slowly became pronounced after awhile.  For my main dish, I said burger me.  Given the options at my disposal, the Bacon Onion Burger was simply too tempting to pass up.  Swiss cheese, bacon, caramelized onions, a bacon-onion marmalade, garlic aioli, lettuce and tomato.  Served with fries and a side of ranch.  I will say the burger wasn't as huge as I thought it would be (other Yelp photos I saw of this burger made it look ginormous), but a really good hearty burger and I loved the marmalade on this thing.  The fries were a nice compliment too as they were cooked well done on the outside, but retained a nice chewy texture inside.  For dessert, I went with the Apple Crumble.  This version was topped with vanilla gelato and a cranberry gastrique.   The portion size of this dessert was quite large and could easily be shared by two.  The soft, warm crumble soaked up that gelato just right and the combo of apple and cranberry flavors worked perfectly.  Total cost for the cocktail, main entree, dessert, tax and tip came to about $40.  The food itself was pretty reasonably priced, though the cocktail was a little bit pricey for the size at $12.  I will say the service I received was a little bit slow.  There were two bartenders working the front and it was pretty clear the one I got was still learning the ropes (didn't catch his name).  His counterpart by comparison was a machine, cranking out drinks, conversing with the bar patrons, and keeping his station organized with almost military precision.  My guy had a little bit of trouble keeping organized which meant I had to wait a bit in between meals.  Not a huge deal though as I'm sure he'll get the hang of it.  The front bar was full of regulars (primarily Downtown workers) from all age groups.  Great pub atmosphere for conversation, people watching, and to let your hair down.  Call it a pub, call it a sports bar, call it a lounge, call it whatever you want.  I call it a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

wsFHcIwOy46ft1w38-LzJw.text: Good service. The one item I had was excellent. The steam mussels were so tasty. Garlic. Oil. Chorizo. White wine. Yum!  The bread it came with was nice and toasty. Great dipper in the sauce.  The place is really cool.  Warm and dark. In a good way.  It was a hot day so I had a beer. Cocktails I have them on cooler days.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The bar is very cool
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steamed mussels are outstanding. Garlic. White wine. Chorizo. What&#39;s not to like.

U258LU1k5gvWylQ0SGo9sQ.text: Amazing meal in downtown Phoenix: outrageously cool waiters and quaint surroundingsCall and ask for the artesian salad with chicken awesome cold and just write call and can't wait to come back

h10t5XV00OoUF9pKxXXdkQ.text: I've been here a few times before going to shows at VB or Crescent.  The food is great, I've had the charcuterie (awesome selection), the pretzel (huge) and the burger.   Service is fast and I am always able to find a seat even on busy nights.

uZhAbooBz25vuTDEhy0sGA.text: Went here while in town for a friends wedding, the ambience was very chill and it was quite busy for being 10pm so definitely a popular place! I loved how it was all open, and they had multiple beers on tap. I had ordered their fish and chips which was very good though also very small, coming from buffalo where are fish frys are HUGE, was a very big difference. But it was very tasty along with the fries that came with it! My husband ordered the black bean burger and said it was a pretty good burger. Definitely a nice place to eat as they have a good amount of options to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

o8t_dbo28JILLprzkseQpw.text: Small, Fun place very conveniently located near Talking Stick arena. Gets very crowded with concert goers.  The night we were there, Eric Clapton was performing. Wings were yummy. Be sure to ask for extra crispy. Fish and chips were average so disappointing. I'm still in search of best fish and chips in Phoenix.  Bartenders were efficient and helpful.

yoFe6aeVrWqUnAKRQw6mfQ.text: I enjoyed the service and the food was pretty good.   We had the steak salad, pork belly sliders and burger.   See pics.

YZeHmVav8VeCt8R2hItOZA.text: So I had read the reviews..."the best pretzel I've ever had", "I'll come back for the pretzel alone". But seriously...it IS the best pretzel I've ever had and I WILL come back for the pretzel alone. The pretzel gets 5+ stars.   The beer selection was pretty good. And any bar that has weekend happy hour is okay in my book!   I only take off one star because my scallops left a little to be desired. They were cooked well, but not well seasoned. I had to salt the entire dish to make it palatable. The fingerling potatoes with dill were actually the highlight of the dish.   We'll be back for sure. That pretzel was the shit.

ZU82iKL1kJ8WVyGNH8e_Kg.text: Yum! Was here for a Saturday night dinner and had a great time. Our server was super sweet (I forget her name though). I had the Broken China drink, which was delicious! To start, we had the pork belly sliders which we really enjoyed! The pork belly was flavorful and crispy, but not overly done. I enjoyed the cole slaw on it as well, not too creamy, but a little tangy. As for my entree, I had the Rueben. It was filled with corned beef! It was a tad salty for me, but it was still delicious nonetheless. My friend had the salmon which looked and tasted super good as well. We'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1PlyvSdhIJjCiwAi8GETNw.text: Great food and even better service from Mikheal (I may be butchering the spelling), plus a great drink menu. We had such a good experience our first visit that we came back a second time during our 3 day stay in Phoenix. Standouts were the bangers and mash, short ribs, and pretzel appetizer. Second visit, we went for the bread pudding as well and it was to die for. My picky teenage son was with us and they had no issue with some modifications to his orders. If we are ever back in downtown Phoenix, this is our first stop!

hrwjJUP_Xzm4Q_7RTPn10g.text: Great service,  good food...friendly staff. Had the Bavarian Pretzel...YUM (little more salt might have made it excellent) followed it with the Southwest Chicken Wrap (the reason for the 4 stars). Very little chicken or avocado, thought it was going to be great...it was meh at best.  I was not impressed, very bland even with the jalapenos :-( I would not ordered it again, just no flavor.  When they filled it before cutting it, I  assure you that they pilled it in the middle so when they cut it in the middle...chicken showed (see photo) but still no avocado...boo!  Now, that being said my friends had Medium Wings with Ranch, and scarfed them down...she loved them. She said the Ranch was real good, not thick and goopey. My other friend had the Bacon Onion Burger and loved it too.   The fries for the me were the saving grace and the pretzel.   Will try again, I was mightily disappointed in the wrap so...may get back there.

eU_gq-Y6h7FgpMFHBV07Xg.text: Such an eclectic mix of patrons and I can see why: great drink options, delicious updates to traditional fare, ambience transitions from bar to long high-top tables to sit and chat to restaurant open booths that feel cost yet open. And the servers and bartender a hoot. So glad I checked yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bangers and mash next to braised short ribs (all meat) with grilled brussel sprouts and bacon, and creamed spaghetti squash
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crepe bead pudding, already ate half, before dinner...

eM-u3EZuLkIcjiy8JzOPqQ.text: Such a great restaurant and bar! Rustic feel but very inviting. The wait staff was very friendly. Went for a late lunch on a Sunday and wasn't busy, I was sat immediately.  They have outdoor seating with misting fans which is a great addition for the hot days.   Impressed with the food! I recommend their chicken sliders and fish and chips! Well worth the visit.

aLVmzg2LAjcSB_3FdOVn6A.text: Dragging my feet toward the plane leaving Cabo San Lucas after an incredible birthday weekend. Wondering why I haven't moved here yet. My girlfriends came across a friendly seat mate on the plane. Sparking up a conversation that lead into being introduced to The Kettle Black kitchen. Turns out out the young man was the co-owner of the establishment. After having a lengthy layover in Arizona. We decided to take an Uber to the restaurant. From the airport it was no more then a ten minute ride. The restaurant was very nice and spacious with a great bar and drink selection. The food was delicious. I suggest try the philly cheese steak fries. The burger were well cooked, huge but really good. The overall meal was very satisfying.  FYI it is very close to the Chase stadium. Definitely will go back when in town to visit family.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Philly steak fries
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hu4KF4g6oKX_v9wCRO77qw.text: I really loved this place. You know it's a good sign when you can't decide what to order because it all sounds delicious. First, we got lucky and walked in (party of 3) on a Saturday around 6:30 and only waited 5 minutes. Staff was on it and prompt and constantly checking in on us despite being packed. Shout out to Mikael (pronounced Michael) for being a 5 star server and helping me make my decision between the 4 things I was eyeing.   I went with the jerk chicken sliders per his suggestion. Those two sliders were juicy, flavorful & the buns were so soft. It didn't taste like jerk sauce but I still loved it. I ordered a side salad but they gave me fries as a mistake. They never caught it and I didn't complain because they were crispy & seasoned.   My party ordered the fish & chips and their house burger and everyone was satisfied. They had a full bar and only a few beers on tap but everyone ordered what they wanted. The place has a cool dark vibe and the music isn't too loud which we appreciated. There was a overly drunk guy they took outside but this didn't ruin my experience! Right in the middle of downtown- a must!

WwJz3BvitXDbB_GNZwEQbQ.text: Kettle Black checks every box that a gastropub should. Woodsy dim decor, excellent beer menu, creative food offerings and excellent service. My only complaint is that it is always too damn busy.   This popular establishment has excellent food. I have been here many times and there are too many satisfying items to name them all, but I have to give a nod to two stand outs. Their soft pretzel is top notch and accompanied by a fantastic cheese dip. The really stellar item however is the scallop dish. Phoenix is of course known for its fresh seafood--or maybe not, but this has not hindered KB from serving one of the best scallop dishes that I have ever had. Perfectly seared scallops are served on a bed of spinach and parsnip puree; the whole thing then drizzled with a slightly spicy reduction. They deftly walk the tightrope of strong and complex flavors that still allow the delicate taste of the scallop to shine through. I actually ordered this dish two nights in a row, something I don't think I have ever done before in my life.

WD8NaQLkiRkJUPKBceS1fw.text: I came in shortly after they opened and sat at the bar. Del was behind the bar and I asked him what he recommended. He named a couple items but the first one he raddled off was the Rueben so that's what I went with (hold the 1000 island because I'm not a fan of mayo). I got it with the side salad and balsamic.  The sandwich was very good. A decent about of corned beef, a good amount of cheese and not too much sauerkraut.   Thanks for letting me hang out while I waited for family to get in from the airport!

YtmNm75jAQW2uDh7_JHiCw.text: We decided to try this place because it was close to Comercia Theater. I ordered the black bean burger with bacon accompanied by fries and my friend ordered the fish & chips. The burger was ok, but I was glad I chose to add bacon because it was a bit dry. The fries however were great! The fish & chips seemed like a favorite per the other reviews, but my friend felt they were 'just okay'. The staff were super nice and attentive, ensuring we had everything we needed. The atmosphere was quite nice as well.

3RhaaZsdJcWbz54aDMRYLg.text: Great little spot to stop for lunch if in downtown Phoenix. We stopped here for a late lunch one day, walked in and seated ourselves. There is a pub/tavern like feel with a bar, booths, and communal tables. We were waited on right away and our waitress was great.  I ordered the turkey burger with fries. The burger was very flavorful, cooked well, and had fresh toppings with it. My husband ordered the pork belly sliders which came on Hawaiian rolls with fries.   We both really enjoyed our meal and the atmosphere. We sat and enjoyed our drinks for quite a while before leaving. If we're ever back in the area we'll certainly have this on our list!

VjZCJaQ4t5YnrL2h80VwpQ.text: A little slow on a summer Thursday evening 530pm.  Great attentive servers who knew their menu.  Bangers and mash were just superb. Big portion.  Only about 12 tables, and about 20 seats at the bar.  I imagine it gets packed easily.  Server recommended the bangers, but also said the fish and chips were great; I'll have to try them next time. Very friendly crowd. Happy hour specials 4-7.

photos.caption: Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Remember to always wash your hands
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BAngers and mash (about half eaten)
Photo of The Kettle Black Kitchen & Pub - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu -- one page but small print. Nice selections.

5Pl-ZCKriVb_N_L68v-x8Q.text: My fiancee and I were looking for a place to stop on the way to a sporting event downtown and we have been trying to check some of the places we've scouted off of our list. We came in on a busy Saturday afternoon and had a couple of drinks and a couple of the appetizers. I ordered some Honey Hot chicken wings and she got the pretzel, and I ordered an IPA to wash down my wings. The service was adequate for how busy they were, and it gave us time to chat while we checked out the decor - which definitely has the English Pub vibe. The wings were pretty good, but I really enjoyed the pretzel - the mustard was phenomenal. I decided to order the fish and chips too, and my only gripe with that was the large size of the fish. I prefer smaller pieces rather than one giant piece, I guess I'm a breading fiend. Beer selection was great, I didn't have a hard time finding a beer that I wanted to drink.   I will come back to throw back some beers and grab some grub at this place, but I think it would be a better place to go with some of my buddies rather than my fiancee. I'll put it on my pregame stop list when any of my friends come up from Tucson to catch a game downtown.
